Update, 4/21/18

My brother hasn't been able to use it because my 14 (soon to be 15) niece forbid him to use it under any circumstance... threatened him with something bad enough that he has it sitting in his shirt drawer since xmas... or maybe my niece just got rid of it. But it got what I wanted:
1) Her oh so funny reaction because my father asked her to translate for him
2) Huge belly laughs from my bother because of # 1 (when did she become Andrea Corleone???).

This shirt is great! Not only does it show potential boyfriends who's really in charge of my daughter, it also teaches her a good lesson as well. Its important that she knows that she is incapable of setting her own boundaries. I'd hate to teach her any sort of self respect, that would only ruin her for the man I finally decide to give her to on her wedding day. as we all know, girls lives are meaningless without the firm guidance of a man, after all. I'm only leaving 4 stars for this shirt because number 8 should clearly say "property", not "princess". Added bonus: the violent threats are a great outlet for my uncontrollable manly rage!

*EDIT
I apologize for my original review on these sandals. I made it right after I got them in the mail and judged them at first sight. But after spending a month and a half with these babies (in and out of the shower), I have come to appreciate their true value.
Though I'm sure these sandals are made of something that's not exactly rubber, I am now certain that the material is not styrofoam. In the shower, they get wet and flexible on my feet. Also, they're good for just walking around the house. Though I haven't worn them outside since I don't want to risk using them anywhere but the shower. They still feel fragile to me.

I stand behind what I said about these sandals arriving in slightly used condition. One of the logos on a sandal was peeled halfway off when I got it in a plastic transparent bag. Plus they used to smell really bad, giving off this powerful odor. But after constant shower use, the smell is finally gone. I'm glad that I can step in and out of the bathroom without having my bare, wet feet touch the floor. Although they're not the best, these are some great sandals. You have my word on that.

But I still think the guys selling this product should post more images of the sandals here. The only customer image (currently provided) is just not enough. It needs to be shown at different angles and in great detail. And they should post a comment about the horrible smell that comes with the sandals!
Seriously! Do it already!
summary: For use in the bathroom and shower only

This mask is very beautiful.  The only thing that is wrong with this mask is in the picture it shows an aqua and black colored mask, and what I received was a purple and black mask.  The mask is identical to the picture.  There is nothing wrong with the mask.  In all honesty I think I like the purple better than the aqua, and this mask goes great with my red hair. The only reason I am giving this a four star is because of the fact that I got a purple and I was expecting aqua just because of the picture. Also, I ordered this mask late in the evening on the 2nd and it arrived on the 5th.

I wanted to use the mask for this years Halloween costume. I ordered this mask and black gloves. I already have a black cape that I wore last Halloween. I wanted to use my prom dress that I wore my Junior Year of High School, but I will simply wear a purple shirt and black pants.  But if I find anything else that would go great with the mask I probably will wear it. If I didn't love the purple so much I would have probably returned it, but I am not and I am actually very satisfied even though the color was not aqua.

I didn't want to give it 3 stars because I do like it.  But this is very disappointing and I'm hoping it doesn't happen to the one I gave as a gift.  I would suggest to anyone buying this, that you get a longer chain and wear it against clothing, not directly against your skin.  My plan is to somehow cut the old bale off and replace it with a sterling silver one and either a longer chain or leather cord.

Great looking top!

Come on people -- these are coming from China and are Chinese Women sizing. The details are provided in the description:

Flat Size S:Length 74cm, Bust 84cm, Waist 88cm M:Length 75cm, Bust 90cm, Waist 94cm L:Length 76cm, Bust 96cm, Waist 100cm XL:Length 77cm, Bust 100cm, Waist 106cm

XL corresponds to something just more than 34 inches (at the bust), so, yeah -- an XL is going to fit like about a Small or Medium. If the shirt LOOKS like this, then the XL should be awesome -- will update this review if the purchase comes out differently.

UPDATE: Ordered Jun 5, Received Jun 16 (11 days). That's pretty quick. Can't promise you'll get yours that quickly. Wife wears US XS or Small - got in XL. I think it would've been better in L (but it's close enough and the style certainly allows to be worn a little loose). As some have mentioned in reviews of this shirt, the photo appears to have two different colors of green, but the green layers are the same color. Even though the layers does give it the look of having two colors, I think the photos in the ad actually ARE two different colors. I think this shirt may be a knock-off of the shirt photographed, which is probably higher quality and has better fitting pattern/cut. The consistent ruffling and angles of the cuts do not match dead on. It's a decent copy, which most knock-offs are, but I really don't believe it's the same product/quality.

UPDATE 2: I found a place to order the AUTHENTIC garment -- it's WAY WAY better. Now that I know for sure this is a knockoff/fake/counterfeit, there's no way it will get more than a 1 star rating. The seller, incidentally, refunded 1/2 my money, but I wish now I had never purchased it at all. Purchase the real thing from Uoften dot com. It's called "Chiffon Multicolour Tiered Sundress top Shirt Blouse Trend".

I'm downgrading from a 5 to a 2. It's an average product, good price, but nothing amazing and I honestly judge that it's not the same product.

Here is a better indication of what you're getting...maybe the manufacturer got cheap :(
[...] (and $7.80 shipped)

When I ordered from this seller I was skeptical. In addition I was disappointed when I saw how long it would take for the shirt to arrive. Much to my surprise it arrived over a week ahead of expected delivery! It fits perfectly and although it isn't as "zig zagged" (I guess you could call it that) in the layers, I adore it! Spring needs to come sooner so I can enjoy this adorable top. (:

I purchased the Metawatch Frame after quite a bit of research and because the Apple iwatch looks like it will be delayed until 2014. It's a good starter smartwatch. It was a bit difficult to get setup and get used to, but the customer support (overnight emails) was good. I synched it to my Android Droid 4. It is a little larger than I would like and the (reflective) screen takes some getting used to. I loaded the Metawatch Manager Noah Edition, as it got the best reviews and is more flexible than the standard watch manager. I had problem with Calendar notifications, so deleted them from the watch, but use the Phone battery, Call, Text, and Gmail notifications and they work OK. Because it is bluetoothed direct to the phone, I was expecting immediate notifications (when the watch vibrated), but there is a little delay. I had another "freeze up" last night after recharging, but a hard boot (2 middle buttons) fixed that. There are 3 available boots, but only one was in the documentation (the rest you get from Support). Not bad for a starter smartwatch.

These sunglasses have held up to my teenager, who is not always nice to them! They have been dropped, kicked,sat on..etc... The little screw has tried to come out, but we tightened them and haven't had any problems. The lenses has also popped out, but you can snap them into place again. They do get scratched easily. The company send them in a timely fashion. Not, bad for the money spent.

reviewText: The shipping was really fast and timely and the seller was great in that aspect. I loved the look of these leggings, but I was a little uneasy about purchasing them after reading the reviews because it seemed like they fit a wide variety of women in different ways. Usually I can fit into small/medium leggings just fine, but these one size fits all are not as comfortable as I was hoping. They don't stretch as much as traditional leggings because the inside is like a fleece material. I am about 5'3" and the length is just like the picture but I'm a a runner so I have muscular thighs and normal size waist. Typically I wear a size 6-8 in jeans, but these leggings are a little big in the waist and pretty tight on my butt and legs so they start to fall down when I move a lot, like if I bend down or walk for a while without pulling them up. They're a good quality for the price, but I would exercise caution if you're a bit curvier because they aren't likely to be as comfy as you're expecting.
summary: Comfortable, warm, good quality material, but one size fits "all" is questionable

reviewText: Took awhile to arrive but everything was great

Recently purchased this outfit, mainly due to how it looks in the pictures. Sadly this was a mistake. When it arrived i knew as soon as I was pulling the fabric out of the bag I had made a wrong turn. It felt scratcy and poor quality and had a weird chemical smell to it.  The jacket portion had two ribbon strings to.. i suppose tie it closed? Both of them were almost partially off the fabric fraying away from the jacket material. The skirt is velcro, and quite short..way too short to use as costume outside of the home. The emblem on the top and tie were attached via poor quality fabric glue and immediate fell off. The white elastic of the tie was dirty. I emailed the seller with pictures and never got a response. I found that most curious as they contacted me twice asking me to go through them if I had problems prior to making a review (I suspect they get bad review frequently) I did first contact them to see if they would remedy my disatisfaction, however as I said they never responded.

Small note on the sizes, as the package indicated their sizes are "asian" ones so smaller than the standard. I wear a size small in most everything I own, and I probably would be more comfortable in a medium of this costume. It isn't so small its unwearable, but could be better... mind you the whole outfit is poor so who knows.
Bigger than advertised... I am 137 lbs 5 ft so not skinny but everything was still big  . Also looks cheaper in person.

It's real damn cute... if it fits on you. The sizes really don't match up quite right. I'm kinda a thin, but it just felt way too big on me. I'm 5"6, 115lbs. The skirt (which just has a weak and easy-to-tear-off velcro connector around the back of the waist) was too big. The tightest I could make it was still showing about two inches of panties. The top ("coat") is *way* to big. The bra (if you could call it that; it was far more uncomfortable and itchy than even the most uncomfortable costume bras I've ever worn) was too tight and small. And even the collar and tie were a bit too big. It's like it was made to fit on a 6-foot-tall average-build man.

Those cute shoes and the thigh-high socks shown in the picture don't come with it. I have a pair of socks and shoes that look kinda like those, so it was okay for me. But I was a bit surprised to find that it didn't come with at least the socks.

If you're a bigger girl with small-ish boobs, then this is great for you. But if you're not very tall and/or overweight and a bit flat-chested, then avoid it. Either that, or I got some weird set that came out of the factory wrong.

(Also, shipping was kinda slow too since it was coming who-knows-where in China. Keep that in mind when ordering).

If you are considering buying this, please do! It's well worth it.

Although the coat compliments my pear shaped figure, it does not accentuate my (flat) chest, but if I tie the belt around my waist the coat will look more flattering. I also have broad shoulders (I am athletic), but thankfully the trench coat is tailored correctly on that area. However, the arms of the coat reaches exactly to my wrist, which I wished could have been a little bit longer. Since I am tall the coat falls perfectly to my thighs and about an inch or two above my knees. The color is also a beautiful neutral beige, and the material is lightweight, waterproof, and durable. The coat is somewhat thin, so if you live in a cold climate you'll have to layer yourself to keep warm, however, I live in a warm climate (California) so this coat is just perfect for any season. Overall, I am satisfied with my item and would repurchase again or recommend to anyone.

reviewText: Im 5ft 2, 135 lbs on the muscular side and this fit great. I usually get hot when it rains but this helped keep me cool and kept me dry during the downpour of a rain I experienced in Budapest

Great product, especially for the price! The mesh lining makes it thin enough to wear on a warm rainy day, and its loose fitting enough to layer up for the cold ones. The sleeves have adjustable straps to keep water from blowing up them, and to prevent unnecessary and annoying movement on your arms. The hood is adjustable as well. It will keep you dry and you will look great in the meantime.

Purchased this jacket be a top layer on a trip to Iceland during their warmer season.  I wanted something light to travel with that would protect against wind and rain. Its served its purpose well. Rain and mud run right off of it, sleeves have the option to Velcro for a closer fit to keep out moisture. I found it a bit challenging to make it packable in the pocket, but it compresses easily into luggage without that. The mesh lining prevents the coat from adhering to you if you're bare-armed under it. My one complaint is that the hood doesnt come far enough past my head to protect my face, so I wore a cap under it. This won't add much warmth, but it does cut the wind chill and functions as an outer shell. I foresee using this quite often for wet summers as well. I typically purchase womens tops in medium unless they're known to run big.  I bought a medium, and if allows me ample room to put multiple layers under.
summary: Nice outer shell to protect against moisture and wind.

This is a great bag. Got it about a week ago and have been using it daily ever since. There is a lot to like about this bag. It is relatively roomy. They did a darn good job making use of the space, with plenty of internal pockets. I have been using a Swiss Gear messenger bag for the last ten years, and the thing still looks brand new. The only reason I switched is because my girlfriend won't give it back to me. :) I also have a 511 messenger bag that is significantly larger. But I wanted something that was a little smaller than that, but could still hold all of my work essentials. The bag is stylish and looks pretty cool for the most part. I will say, though, that I expected a little more "pop" from Oakley. As cool as the bag is, it is incredibly drab looking. Just--black. They could have at least thrown in some highlight colors to make it a little cooler looking, but that is a minor complain overall. At this point, my only real question is that of durability. I certainly have no reason to suspect it won't live up to the daily grind that my Swiss Gear handled with ease, so only time will tell.

The only thing I really don't like about the bag, which I consider a waste of space, is that they took up an entire side of the bag with one of those luggage slip-over sleeves so you could attach it to your wheeled luggage. A good feature if you travel a lot, but for the rest of us it is a complete and total waste of space that could have been used for something else. The only other complain I have is the "water bottle holder." I put that in quotes because I don't think it will fit the role very well. It can be tightened down, but it won't hold a very big bottle at all. Even worse, the pouch isn't very deep. Poorly designed. Other than that, a very cool, stylish, and great professional accessory!
summary: Great bag, if a little dull looking. Come on Oakley!

First, please pay attention to all of the sizing and quality reviews. On size: I'm 5'8"/170 lbs, with an athletic build. I normally wear a medium if I want a slim fit and a large when I want a loose fit. For this coat, I wanted slim fit, so I went with the U.S. Medium which equates to the XXL size under the Asian measurements.

The jacket fits snugly in the arms. I'm able to wear a dress shirt and sweater under the coat. The body fits fine, but the arms fit a bit snugly in the bicep area. Odd feeling, but nothing alarming.

On quality: You get what you pay for. The left pocket's lining ripped on my second time wearing it. That does not bother me much, because I had it sewn back together. No harm, no foul. I got what I paid for.

On style: The coat is not long at all. It basically hits me just at or below my waistline. It looks really contemporary and is lightweight. You will not keep out the cold at all, but you'll look nice.

reviewText: I love this hoodie. I figured it would be a little bit oversized so I got an xs and it fits perfectly. I'm 5'5 and 120 pounds, for reference. It's so soft on the inside and I love the paste colors. It's so cute!

I bought this cosplay for my sister who has recently been watching this anime. As soon as she saw it, she was so happy. She wore it right away. Since you can have it custom-made without extra charges I found that convenient. It does come with everything you see in the picture EXCEPT for the boots, which is listed. The cape was well made, but some of the pattern of the back still had strings on it so we had to cut off those extensions, but it was an easy fix. The jacket (that's underneath the cape) was probably the best quality product in the whole outfit. It was made of pleather and the insides had smooth and slippery material, it has a silky feel to the inside. The shirt underneath the jacket was big but the neck was made kind of tightly. However, there are lace-up strings on the shirt (only about 3 on the right and 3 holes on the left for lacing up) that can help you loosen the neck area. The band around the waist kind of looks like a skimpy pleather skirt alone. You could probably use it for clubbing or something. It was longer than expected, but it was still made of good material. The white pants seemed a little light. They're kind of see-through and made of normal fabrics. By normal fabrics, I mean, the kind you can buy from Walmart and make baby's blankets out of. However, I believe that the thinness of this fabric does help to ensure that the straps (that hold the gear) are more fit to your body. The straps for the gears were kind of confusing. There were a lot of strange twists and turns but we had a friend help with those. It doesn't help that her legs were short and the gear is much longer than her leg. Overall, the cosplay looked great on her and she had a great time at the convention dressing up! I am satisfied with this product, but I would only recommend this outfit to others who are just starting out their cosplay career. Why? Because there are much better products (although they are more expensive) and it will give you a sense of how you feel towards cosplaying.

reviewText: Really didn't get what i was looking for. Nothing that people want to trade for. Lots of scrappers which are worth nothing

These arrived promptly.  Each came with a black Mickey shaped back.  Individually wrapped in tiny clear bag.  Some doubles, but this didn't bother me since we are planning on trading and divided lot between 4 kids.
 To be fair, I've never seen a Disney pin before these arrived.  Didn't know anything more about Disney pins than what I read online. I looked for the obvious signs that these may not be official Disney pins.  These pins all looked good to me, but I didn't want to pass counterfeit pins, so we stopped at the official pin store in Downtown Disney in Florida to get these checked out before trading.
We pinned about 25 on each of the 4 kids lanyards and pouches that hangs from them, then we went to the store.  They had a board that had used trading pins on it so each kid could trade a pin.  Most of the pins on our lanyards were the same ones that they had on the board (so they are not rare).  While waiting in line, I spoke with the salesgirl who was helping us.  She checked out our pins (without taking them off of lanyards).  She said they looked real, but would have to check each out if we really wanted to know.  She looked at about a dozen off of the lanyard and thought they are official Disney pins and let us trade 4 for other pins from the trading board.
Good enough for me.  My kids had a great time trading them all week with disney parks staff, Disney hotel staff, and other pin enthusiasts.

Only one problem with these pins.  It may be a problem for all Disney pins, again...I have no experience with this.  The backs of about a dozen of them fell off, resulting in lost pins.  After we lost the first few, we put our favorites INSIDE each zipped lanyard pouch so they wouldn't get lost.  (If we ever go again, I will purchase clear plastic pouches that zip, to hang from lanyards to hold the kids most prized pins that they want to show off, but not trade.).
We bought 4 of the cheapest pins we could find at Epcot for $7-$10 each.  They appear to have similar backs.  I would be upset if a dozen $10 pins got lost, but for the price of this lot, I'm really not mad.  For how much fun my kids had, these were definitely a great buy!
Very reliable and nice pins! Great for keeping or trading!!! Half of the pins had hidden Mickeys :) Different both orders...

All the pins said Disney on the back, but most of them were cheap looking and not very interesting.  A few were pretty nice.  I got one princess tiana pin that was cute.  It's hard to get what you want when ordering a lot where you are not shown exactly what you are going to get.  I probably wouldn't have purchased them if I would have known what I was actually getting.

I AM FURIOUS. I suggest going back and checking all purchases made with this seller against an official guide. I have found several scrapper pins in my lot. I find this unacceptable, as the seller promises this will not happen. Yes, the pins are marked While the pins do have the official "stamp" if you look closely, you will find that they are fraudulent pins. These pins will not be accepted for trade in Disney parks!!!!! For example: Pin says "Cast Lanyard Coilection" instead of "Collection." It is clearly an "i." The copyright "c" is an "o." You cannot trade these fraudulent pins!
summary: DO NOT SHOP WITH THIS BUYER! RECEIVED FRAUDULENT PINS

reviewText: Bought two hundred piece lots. The pins were all individually bagged and in brand new shape, all of them with the Mickey head back. They are perfect trading pins, you would be hard pressed to find these pins for less than a buck or two each anywhere else. All in all, good items received exactly as described in a timely fashion from an excellent seller.
There were some duplicates, but I was splitting them between 4 people. I also received a little over 100 pins, so that was definitely a nice surprise.

Pins are EXACTLY as advertised. All are suitable for trading, and some are keepers. Excellent variety, with few duplicates (none in the 25-count size). Each pin is individually bagged for sorting, storage, and trading. A great value, considering new pins sell for $5-$10 EACH at the parks! I suggest only gettintg a 25-pin lot for 1 or 2 novice traders heading to Disney for a vacation.
summary: Pins for trading, but not many for keeping

I was surprised by how quickly it dried when I wore it INTO the pool and how warm it kept me while I barbecued during the process. I love it!

This wrap is fabulous, even better than I thought it would be!  I was thinking it might be one of the heavier cover ups (like classic sarong fabric, cotton) but it is scarf material instead (like chiffon).

It is nice, light and breathable.  The design on this wrap is awesome and the colors are bright and vivid.  The detail is fabulous a well!

I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a light cover up for the beach or even just as a scarf.
summary: Fabulous wrap for a fabulous price!

The elastic of the band is very subtle; this is I guess so the pressure isn't too much and cause discomfort, but in practice, it slips off the head easily. The material of the band holds on to hers and scarves well, but the band itself slips off. Did not work for my use so it was returned.
Pretty & holds well. Also - great customer service! I had a small issue, and it was taken care of promptly, courteously, and professionally. Highly recommend.

My wife got this buckle for me for my birthday. (she was inspired by a character from "The Big Bang Theory", hopefully i'm not as nerdy as that guy). I'm glad she got this one, because:
1: It's superman. Period.
2: It actually is steel. and nothing else. (and if you're going to be authentic "Man of Steel" it better actually be steel and not some cheap plastic)
3: It's shiny and showy like any good belt buckle should be, but it's one solid color, and just barely distinguished enough that i'm not afraid of wearing it to work and having my boss think i'm in grade school because I have a loud, multicolored, belt buckle. (rather, he still may think i'm in grade school because i like superheros).

reviewText:
Love these.  Only one problem:  They clean up well, but I have to be careful to put the bras in one of the Bags that are often used to Wash the delecates.  The pads come out of the pockets sometimes when washing.  I tried to let them just be with a small number of items being washed.  Didn't work so I now keep the bras in a bags--even there the pads will come out but for the most part are fine.
I did error once and washed the red one in with other delicates - oops!! the pads didn't come out so now I have pink slashes on some of my unfies.

This won't keep me from using them but I need to be more careful with the washing.

I love these things. i've never, ever been able to figure out bra size, so I just went with 'small' and crossed my fingers. They fit perfectly, are super comfortable, and still manage to look really nice. I love the selection of colors and they haven't faded at all, even though I'm crap at doing laundry and just toss them all in with everything else. Only thing I've had a problem with is that they come apart a bit in the wash. The straps come off sometimes and the triangular inserts sometimes come out and get lost. reviewText: For the price, you can't beat it!!  These bras are comfortable, supportive and have a little padding so nipples don't show.

I bought two of these bras, not on Amazon, but at the gym. I have a smaller band size, but a larger cup size. I'm a 32DD, which is a difficult size to find unless you want to pay a lot of money, especially if you want wireless and cute. To give other women some idea of size, my cup size is the same as a 34D or 36C. I add this, because it seems a lot of reviews have only cup size & the size of cups varies depending on band size. So a DD on one person can look very different than the same cup size on another person. Anyway, I bought a dark green and royal purple. They work really well as sports bras, but they wouldn't work well for every day bras for me. That being said, I love them as sports bras! They're cute & comfortable with good support. And I definitely want to buy more.  I hope this helps when it comes to size

I used to tease my neighbor for wearing what I thought were "kid shoes" then tried her Crocs on one day and found them to be super comfy. I read the online reviews for the rain boots before buying them but was fairly certain I would get the size wrong and have to return them.

First: They arrived WAY faster than what was stated and than I expected. I hesitated buying them because I didn't want to wait a month to receive them. They should shorten that window referenced. It took less than two weeks.
Second: They were 100% true to size for me and I was able to start wearing them right away.

I read they have no arch support so they wouldn't be comfortable to wear all day but I found that not to be the case for me. I wear them with sox and have worn them all day - walking the dog around my hood, at the dog park, to work and running errands. They softer than other rain boots I've tried on. I've had no issues at all. Super comfortable and stylish. I get compliments regularly and actually hate taking them off. I may have to buy some slippers now for around the house.

I've only needed to wear them once or twice, though--this may soften up with more usage, as our other Crocs shoes have. As for the company who shipped them, wow...I was amazed that boots shipping all the way from Germany to Ohio arrived so quickly! It was less than two weeks, although they indicated it might take much longer. Overall, I'm pleased. I'll update about the softness issue after I've had more opportunities to wear them and really break them in.

reviewText: My husband loves these. Roomy, the waistband holds up well, soft.

These knit boxers by Hathaway offer an appealing combination of trim fit with soft and stretchy comfort. Originally purchased at a big box store that starts with a C and ends with an O, we were a little unsure if these boxers would be the same, and they are.

The fabric is a 95% cotton 5% spandex knit that is soft with just the right amount of give. The waistband is sewn on but is extremely soft and stretchy and doesnt bind or rub. The legs are short and the overall fit is trim without being form fitting. My husband normally wears a 35 or 36 pant and the medium fits him perfectly.

The photograph on the product page seems to be of the dark blue short. The images would have you believe this has the qualities of a peacoat, but it really doesn't. It's just a hoodie with buttons instead of a zipper, pretty much. Speaking of which, the myriad buttons are a pain to snap up every time you want to wear the garment. It's a unique look but it's not very practical; this isn't a hoodie you can just slip on real quick and be on your way. Given the Asian sizing system, I ordered a Large for my Small/Medium American frame; it fits well with enough looseness to move, but the fit isn't as tight as the images would suggest. There's significant "poochiness" in the stomach section, so don't expect to look barrel-chested with a flat stomach while wearing this -- even if you possess that physique. I ordered the burgundy but the actual product is more of a bright crimson red; I'm fine with that but it's a discrepancy potential buyers should be aware of. I will give props for its warmth, however. The material is thick, relatively soft, and very toasty. The cuffs and bottom trim feature somewhat constricting elastic bands, however, which can be uncomfortable. The buttons are also somewhat feminine for a men's coat, featuring what more-or-less could be described as a flower motif. Overall, I didn't feel it was as stylish as the pictures suggest, but it's definitely durable and warm.
summary: Not As Stylish As I Thought, But Durable and Warm

They look a little like wheel spokes or almost flowers.  My son is currently very happy with his purchase.

4/14/2014:
My girl ordered this for me figuring she'd take a chance. Great deal! I got it sooner than expected and it fit great!

I'm a slim athletic build and V shape torso. She based my size on the measurements listed on the sizing chart. It's fairly accurate. If you fit in the medium, and you're right at the top, it will fit like a fitted shirt not that baggy stuff a lot of people are used to. USE THE SIZING CHART.  Girls, if you're ordering for your man don't just believe him that he's a large. That means get your measurements. The cut of this jacket is slimmer than most.

The material is not stiff.  It's basically a dressy sweatshirt hoodie.
For me, it's a little baggy in the mid-section, but it fits me perfectly otherwise. It's very warm for a sweatshirt because of the double breasted front, and the hood is actually big enough to put on. Sometimes these Asian-made jackets have tiny little hoods, but that's not the case here. It's average. Someone complained about snapping all those buttons, to which I say, How long is a New York minute?  Longer than it takes you to snap those buttons, and WAY shorter than a SoCal minute.

CONS: I got a red one. The bands around the cuffs and bottom are different fabric than the body. This means that as it is washed and worn, the two fabrics may fade differently. *Will update in future.
Also, this looks a lot like a regular hoodie from the back. If you're wearing it with nicer clothes, it will dress you down A LOT.  I've decided that adding darts to the back will dress it up a little bit.  PLUS, it will make it noticeably more fitted.

VERDICT:
If you think you like it, buy it!
summary: Use the Sizing Chart - No big complaints

It's always hard to tell what a piece of jewelry looks like online, especially regarding the size. With "Sterling Silver Blue and White Diamond Double Heart Pendant Necklace," you more or less get what you see in the picture.

The pendant portion is not very small, since the double heart pendant is approximately the size of an average person's thumbnail. It's a dainty pendant, and fairly pretty. It has visible tiny chips of blue diamond on the inner heart, which is quite pretty, but I couldn't really make out the white diamond chips amid the sterling silver texturing.

However, the design is a little bit awkward. The chain is much flimsier than the pendant, and it has a tendency to get looped around and twisted, which will flip the pendant around in odd ways. I wasn't initially sure how it was supposed to hang.

This Sterling Silver Blue and White Diamond Double Heart Pendant Necklace looks pretty, but it's really small and doesn't really stand out when worn. Also, there are supposed to be small little diamond chips somewhere on it but my wife and I can't see them anywhere. It comes off as rather cheap, and because of that I don't really recommend it.
summary: Small, and where are the diamond chips?

reviewText:
I had great expectations for this Double Heart Pendant Necklace, and was frankly just a bit disappointed when I opened the package and looked at it.  I am not a jewelry expert, however I was expecting something a bit more vibrant.  The blue gets lost in the design and there is just not much here that catches the eye.  The pendant is very lightweight and the chain is very thin. It knotted up the minute I  removed it from the package.

I also expected that the center heart would "float", however it is attached to the outer heart.  The hearts hang a bit askew, as the chain loops through the outer heart, giving it a slightly off balance look.  Given my limited experience with quality jewelry items, I still am forced to state that this pendant looks rather cheaply made and is not a recommend.

We took our boys sledding for the first time ever and quickly realized that their knitted gloves wouldn't provide enough protection from the cold and wet.  After reading through all the reviews for all the different kids snow gloves, we settled on two and let each boy pick which they really liked.  Our youngest chose this design.  We've had them for about a month now and so far so good.  They haven't really been put to the test yet since our snow is pretty much gone, but they seem sturdy enough and have kept his hands warm.  He's almost 4 and average sized, so we ordered the 3-5yr; the fingers are almost 2 inches too long but it doesn't seem to bother him.  We'll see how well they hold up for next winter.

We live in a cold climate and mittens keep your fingers a lot warmer than gloves. These are quality snow gloves, they have a waterproof and Thinsulate layers that keep hands warm and dry. I've been impressed with the quality. These were bought to match a coat, and hopefully make it through 2 kids. The color match to the coat wasn't exact, but close enough.

The gloves out lived the coat. They are still in excellent shape, which is a surprise considering we play outside roughly an hour a day all winter long and kids use there hands to get into everything. The lighter color on the back of the hand makes it easy to write our last name boldly across them so that if misplaced at school they can be easily located.

reviewText: I'm just gonna start off by saying that I'm a big dude. I don't usually stray from the Big and Tall sections, but this shirt got my hopes up when I saw it came in bigger sizes. Unfortunatly, this was not even remotely close to size. I know it says slim fit, but there is no reason this shirt should come up under big sizes at all. I fell in love with the look of this shirt when I first saw it and I usually wear a 3xl but decided to order a 4xl as I know shirts from companies that don't specialize in Big and Tall usually run small. The size is a joke. I wear a 19 to 20" neck, a 36/37 sleeve, and sitting around my true waist (on the stomach) is a 52". This not even remotly close to the advertised size. I expected it to be snug with the slim fit, but this shirt is easily 3 or 4 sizes too small in the chest alone. It seriously cannot be more than a large or xl, and it should have been advertised as a Tall Large. It nearly fits my shoulder width and arms when I put it on, and it leaves my entire chest exposed. With this sizing I would be wearing at least an 8 or 9xl just to fit their shirt. Maybe it was my mistake to expect it to be both "slim fit" and "4xl" but I don't usually associate 4xl with being this small. Big men beware, this is not a Big and Tall friendly shirt!

Do not be prepared for punk rock, piracy, soldiering, cyber-punking, orphan-annieing, puddle-jumping, or faking height to get on big kid rides. DO NOT freak out the PTA at the parochial preK. I swear, it's no fun at all.
summary: Gorgeous, comfortable, hard core inexpensive adventure shoes

While the center stone has a few inclusions (a few dark spots), which is listed in the specifications, you can barely see them.  The cut of the stone masks them beautifully.  I couldn't actually tell they were there for days.  Mine also arrived cloudless, which I honestly wasn't expecting.

It fits great, and the halo kind of creates an allusion box, making the center stone look larger.  And the accent stones, while much tinier than they show in the photos, are a perfect delicate touch.

It arrived well packaged, with all of the stones where they should be.  The little blue ring box they sent it in was a bit tacky, but I hardly noticed, and neither would you!

WARNING: THIS SELLER DOES NOT TAKE RETURNS. I went according to the size chart provided...M should have a sleeve length of 59 cm, and a shoulder measurement of 37. The coat I received was labelled M, but had sleeves only 53 cm long!!! It was also only 34 cm shoulder width, and overall MUCH too small. I understand ordering "up" when the reviews say it runs small, but the jacket should not be 6 cm off from the measurements the seller provides...especially in sleeve length of all places (super easy measurement to do...)When I contacted the seller, I was merely asked to "please keep it." Since the sizing issue was most definitely not my fault, I was somewhat upset by just being brushed off. THE SIZING CHART THEY PROVIDE IS INCORRECT (or their sizing is terribly inconsistent). STRONGLY SUGGEST ORDERING AT LEAST 3 SIZES UP.

Ok, so I'm 5'5" and a size 12/14 and I fluctuate between 170-185 (I'm on the heavier size in the photo) and ordered an XL. I LOVE rompers, like I want to live in them this summer, the vast majority are crazy short or overall tiny. I'm a mom and closing in on 37 and am overweight but I want to be in in this trend.

This romper is perfect. The shorts aren't itty bitty, it covers my floppy upper arms, and the attached tie belt can be done in the front to help hide the tummy or in the back depending on your comfort level. And pockets! Plus its very flattering.

I'm a little unsure why there is a zipper, unless it's for people who do order this on the smaller size who can't get out the surplice top, but I can just untie and pull it off.

While plain (and sometimes boring) black, I can wear super cute sandals or gorgeous heels and jewelry and dress it up or down.

The shorts are baggy enough to do the pull to the side and pee if you girls know what I'm talking about. So you don't need to strip in a public bathroom unless that's you're thing.

One suggestion I learned from another romper I own, pick up a package of tiny snaps from the store and see them wherever you want to keep the surplice closed. So if this is a tad on the shower side, a simple tiny snap is a few stitches away from keeping this closed where you're comfortable while allowing easy removal when needed.
summary: Cute! You don't need to be a petite 20 year old to rock a romper

reviewText:
I love Henley neck shirts.  I also love sleeveless, so I thought I had a winner here.  Well... not so fast.

The cloth is not a bad thickness for a T-shirt.  Not the usual thin crap you get, but also not the real comfortable thick.  The ribbing on the gray "T" I received made the cloth feel a little thicker.  Not too bad.  The cotton was soft and not scratchy which is another plus, upon receiving it, of course I had to wash it.  I was hoping it would shrink a little.  Looking at the reviews and sizing chart, I knew already to order at least a size or 2 larger than my US size.  I wear a large shirt (US).  So although the scale said US XL/Asia XXL (JPSK15), it actually fit like a large (US).  I suppose if you like REALLY tight shirts you can go one size large, but for a really good, form fitting, yet not super tight I would go 2 sizes up.

NOW my main complaint.  The neck!  WAY TO BIG!  There is something totally not right with the cut of the neck, making it not only feel weird, but look a little strange.  A traditional Henley has a smaller neck, similar to a traditional "T" shirt.  I was going to wear this under an open button up shirt, but I think this may just become a gym shirt as I really do not like the way the neck looks on me.

minus 1/2 star for sizing chart being off, and minus 1 star for the neck being wacked.

Total 3.5 star rating.

reviewText: I am really going to do more to avoid these clothing items sourced with Asian sizes.  They are poorly made, and don't translate to a Western body frame, since I am no longer 115#.  The neck opening is not evenly cut (the right side is wider than the left); even when buttoned the chest sags forward and the arm holes are too tight.  Going to good will in the next trip; not worth trying to wear again.

Unfortunately, other reviews are dead wrong.  The sizes listed ARE the correct sizes.  I ordered an Asian XXL, which the seller says is an American L, but other reviews claim would be an American XL.  I need an American XL.  An American L was what actually arrived. The sizes listed ARE correct, so order your size according to that chart.

Additionally, as others have noted, the neckline is much lower than it appears in the photo.  I am a stocky, muscular guy, and I like how small the arm holes are and that it doesn't show off a lot of back like most tank tops do.  I am also disappointed at how short the tank top runs.  Most tanktops run a little longer for sport/gym use.  I would never wear this to the gym, because as soon as you move, your midriff will be exposed unless you're wearing very high-waisted pants.  The material is decent, but thin.

Real shame.  Love the look of it on Amazon, but not how it actually looks in person.
summary: Sellers' Posted Sizes Are Correct  - Disregard Other Reviews!

reviewText: This is my fourth Dooney of this style. I love the square satchel look and the size is perfect for my needs. The two zip pockets on the outside are convenient for keys, phone, whatever you like. They are not large and the zippers are a bit stiff but I can live with that--all four of my bags have that small problem. The leather is a wonderful pebble grain, sturdy but soft, and the bag has just enough structure with feet on the bottom. I generally use the double handles over my forearm but the shoulder strap is a nice convenience when needed. This is a $288.00 handbag and though I've never paid full price for any of my four, $99.00 was the best deal yet! The brown is a beautiful rich color and the contrasting trim makes it perfect for autumn!

I noted a lot of the great reviews for this item were from a while ago [when I believe this listing was sold by another seller]. I checked the only current seller's [Lisa-cosplay] reviews and there were so many comments about the quality of the costumes they made, I decided to take the risk.

I really wish I hadn't.

I chose this listing due to the fabric, the design, the patch/embroidery work and collar - specifically the lines across the chest and skirt design which was so similar to The Original Series design. Unfortunately, what arrived in the mail at the end of the estimated ship time was nothing at all like this product. It looked like a parachute mock-up. Material was some sort of nylon/polyester, measurements did not match [there was no indent inwards to indicate a waist - just straight bag dress], the front patch was not embroidered but some kind of over-sized iron on, and I could go on and on. Basically, item is not as described through seller - it is practically a different dress. I have noted since this incident, the price has bumped up significantly for this listing - so perhaps they had 2 tiers of costume available, but to my knowledge the high quality photos are *not* the same product as being sold.
The size was incorrect, it was not as listed, way too big.  This item will probably sit in my closed for the next 2 years and be disposed of at a good will store.

Firstly, item is excellent, outstanding studio quality. Now, the bad news. It comes from China. I ordered and paid for two (for my nieces, I don't cross dress). The enclosed (photocopy) custom's receipt was for one 'sample' item. I was all set to complain to Amazon, but it was identified in the despatch e-mail to contact the seller. I put into the to hard basket as I was sure any complaint would have taken too much time off my life, lost in effort with China. I would recommend the product, but not the seller.

reviewText:
Pros: Excellent quality and construction. This is definitely not a cheap wear-once costume, it is durable enough for everyday wear like normal clothes (and I intend to have fun with it as such)! Fabric ends up feeling like a pique polo dress for year-round comfort. Haven't washed it yet but it seems like it will stand up well.

Cons: Custom measurements came back a little more "generous" than I wanted but it still fits well and is very comfortable to wear. Color was not as vibrant as in the photos but that is to be expected when comparing onscreen color photos to real life examples; it ended up being an almost robin's-egg sort of green-blue shade rather than a "pure" blue--- not bad, just not very accurate to the TV costumes.

Overall I'm very happy and would consider buying other pieces from this seller. Thanks!

I've always been relatively apprehensive about ordering from overseas cosplay companies based on the horror stories of others, but after reading all the other positive reviews, I ultimately decided to take the plunge and order a blue science officer dress. Like the other reviewers said, this company does not disappoint--I was impressed in so many ways with all aspects of this transaction. First, the product shipped in four days. FOUR DAYS. From CHINA. That's craziness, in and of itself. It's probably the fastest overseas shipping I've seen, and I do a lot of ordering from the U.K. Secondly, the item was exactly as described, if not better than in the photo. While the photo shows some bulges in the fabric on the back, the costume shows no hint of such abnormalities when worn. I'm 5'1", 130 pounds, and a size small fit like a glove (and a very flattering glove, at that--flared skirts, amiright ladies). It's not too short, either, which is important because there are no built in shorts like on TOS. Thirdly, the physical quality of the item far surpassed my expectations from the photos. It's made from a thick, cotton-y material that is very flattering and official looking, rather than the cheap, thin material often used in costumes from halloween stores. The stitching is excellent, and all the seams are neat and professional looking. Also, the blue costume is far more "baby's blue" than the more rich turquoise of the photo, which is definitely more true to the series. I'm so glad I bought this instead of the $300 version from Anovos, as I really don't see how much better it could be than this.

reviewText: I was hoping to have this dress for a set of pictures I was having done but my disappointment left when I received this product. reviewText: This costume is so well made! Great stitching, great heavy material, really good quality. I ordered a size up as per their recommendations and it fits good. Its a bit loose but I would rather it loose than too tight. It is comfy and cute! I would definitely recommend this company and will purchase  from them in the future if I want a costume! Also, it came weeks earlier than expected!

The sizing guide matched perfectly; the material is excellent and the whole costume looks great. Very rapid delivery too.

The dress is longer than the ones in the Original Series, but it makes sense for it to be since this costume is an actual dress whereas the Original Series uniforms have built-in shorts under the dress.

Overall I am very pleased with the costume!

I am petite and normally wear a size small or 4. However I took my measurements and went with the company's standard medium size. The sleeves ended up just a tad (maybe a 1/4") too long for me but otherwise it fits very well. It did have a slight odor upon arrival but I washed it on cold & delicate and laid it out to dry.  It washed beautifully.  No shrinkage that I could detect or color run.  I can't wait to wear this!

I am SO impressed. Ordered this July 25th, got it August 2. Fastest international shipping I've ever experienced, and the shipping rate was so reasonable!

I am so happy I didn't order the other uniform available from a mass costume retailer.  Yes, it's half the price, but this quality is so much better.  It feels like a nice thick, yet soft cotton, and it looks just like the photo.  It even has a side zipper.  The emblem is a very nice size and I love the faux-wrap detail.  Sizing is very true as well.  If you typically wear a small, order a small.

I bought it to wear to a Star Trek con, and I'm even more excited now.  I haven't washed it yet, considering the DHL driver delivered less than an hour ago, but it looks like it has sturdy seams.  The collar lays flat, a common complaint with the other costume like this available, and the gold braiding around the cuffs is securely sewn on.

I fell in love with the posted photo and was not disappointed at all.
It's awesome
Paid a lot less than what it goes for now,  get a lot of complements on it when I carry it.  Overall, good for the price.

reviewText: Theses worked very well for me.

Or, if they are, they're mixed/plated with something. I had a terrible allergic reaction to these, where my holes swelled up and started to weep. Both the tunnels and the tapers do it.

I took everything out, cleaned them with a sea salt solution, let them heal, and lost about 3 sizes. After everything was healed up, I put the smallest size that would fit back into my ears, and woke up the next morning with weeping holes again.

There is another review on here that stated the same thing. Please listen to us if you've ever experienced any sensitivity to non-pure skin safe metals.

I did all of my stretching with these tapers and tunnels and they worked really well when used with a balm or oil to aide the friction problem (and of course waiting till your ears are ready). Once I reached 10g, my ears started to produce a lot of liquid, and were so tender. I thought Id stretched up to fast,  but it proceeded even until 0g. I was losing my patience. Id tried taping over the tunnels to stretch up slower than with tapers, Id tried cleaning 3 times daily, I applied balm as soon as the last dose had been absorbed... but the oozing was so bad, it would make spots on my pillows at night (not to mention, the pain kept me from sleeping) and they were never dry. Itd even drip. It was really nasty and my gauges began to be a source of self consciousness for me. Finally, I bought some scilicon tunnels. I thought theyd be softer and I wouldnt irritate my ears with movement while I slept. It was after a few days of the scilicon tunnels that I tried these again andwhatever progress Id made with healing was immediately reversed, and it was a worse reaction than ever! I FINALLY realized that I was ALLERGIC to something in this blend of surgical steel. If youve worked through this whole review, please do yourself a favor and listen to your body. If your ears don't calm down from a stretch up within a day or two, 1)try cleanliness and oils 2) try a different material 3) downsize and wait till your ears are nice and healthy again to try the stretch once more.
summary: please do yourself a favor and listen to your body.

reviewText:
First Id like to point out that you're not missing sizes if your kit goes from 6mm to 8mm to 10mm.  After 2g you begin stretching your ears 2mm at a time. Youre not missing sizes. I believe its shown in the description as well that it goes up by 2mm.
Aside from that, Ive been stretching my ears for a few years now. Around a year ago I took them out and they shrunk quite a bit from 7/8 or 22mm down to about 6g. I purchased this kit to stretch them back out. Theyre very nice and great quality for the price. Id recommend to anyone stretching their ears.

Having my ears stretched for quite some time, I eventually let them shrink down to a 10g for work. After I got a new job they didn't mind if it was gauged or not. I went from a 10g to a 0g in 2 weeks using this set. A read a few reviews where people had been complaining of not having a 7mm gauge. AND I honestly didn't see the point in having every single mm size trying to stretch. I mean if you're that scared of tearing your lobe or that sensitive then don't even stretch to begin with.
Tapers and tunnels are very short and should not be used for stretching.  2 stars because they are exactly as described.
summary: Tapers and tunnels are very short and should not be ...

I purchased this to wear after our swim class on the very cold walk from the pool to the locker room. It was a great purchase, if not the most well-made item. When it arrived there were a few threads hanging loose, and while the zipper is fine, it's not the best quality and sometimes tricky to use.

However, every other similar item I found was very obviously made for girls. Having a long, terry cloth, zippered robe, has been great. Since kids grow so fast, I don't expect to get more than 2 years of use out of it, and I think it will hold up good enough to last us 2 years. In that sense, I do recommend this item.

Shipping was not as fast as I hoped for but the dress arrived well packaged so I can't really complain.
First, the dress is NOT double breasted, it only has bright white buttons lining the torso to make it appear it is double breasted. The material is rather thin with a full polyester lining, zipper in the back, true navy blue colour with cheap bright white ribbon lining the collar and pockets. I imagine I am going to have to replace the ribbons as the bottom ones on the pockets are already frayed (right out of the package). I wish I would have ordered one dress size up as it's a bit snug and shorter than I expected but it's cute and I'll still wear it. (Just for reference I ordered a medium and am 110lbs, 5'4" and rather busty 34ddd). If you want a tighter fit and you're my size then stick with the medium, but if you want a little more breathing room go with a large.
Overall, the dress is cute and totally wearable despite it's minor repairs, I would buy from this seller again (especially considering the price for other nautical theme dresses).

When i first recieved this wig, i freaked out because it felt like it was not fitting correctly. the only way i was able to make it fit was by pulling the flames apart from each other. Finally it fit my head with bobby pins securing it. I was thankful it finally fit because i needed it for a costume i was going to wear for comic con.

I used this wig, coupled with a red graduation gown from the thrift shop, to represent a head master demon in a skit at my church. The flames gave the illusion of two yellow horns at the crown of the wig, thereby adding a perfect authority to the head demon's costume. Everyone is still talking about the visual image we were able to offer. My order of this wig was promptly processed and arrived with ample time prior to the event.
summary: Flaming Victory through Amazon's quick response

reviewText: I have learned that 58 cm (7 1/4") is a very loose standard. On the Western Wear hats it is tight-fitting. Stetson is what you would expect (perfect fit). On this Justin hat, the fit is a little loose but not bad. Very wearable. The color is a little off on the web image. It is, in fact, a true Silverbelly (beige). Also, the crown is 4" instead of 4 1/2". No one will notice that except the owner and, of course, some people prefer the look. The quality construction is excellent with the caveat that this is a 2X wool hat. Overall, considering the low price, this will be a great daily wear item and I am well pleased with my purchase.

reviewText:
The hat is okay, although not what I expected from Justin.  I have never worn Justin hats but have worn their boots for 50 years, along with Tony Lama, Nocona and custom fitted boots from Lubbock, TX.  I primarily wore Resistol and some Stetson, always going for 4X or better.  This hat, by a good company, was rated 4X but the rating must be totally different from Stetson.  This hat is far too stiff-maybe that's the style now?  I stopped wearing western hats and boots as I got older and needed more padding under my feet.  I recently tried to buy a hat due to the weather.  I could not find a satisfactory hat on line, western or otherwise.  I guess I will have to breakdown and spend the $400 or $500 to get a good hat.
I'm sure this product will totally satisfy many purchasers.
summary: always going for 4X or better. This hat

reviewText: Resistol hats are comparable to Stetson, frequently better because though Stetson still has great hats, they tend to be overpriced because of the name. I bought one some 18 years ago which I eventually wore out, but the price I just bought this hat for was the exact price I paid for my first G.S. model Resistol 18 years ago..no inflated cost!  I also have wore Resistol felt/beaver blend hats for years and they are superb. I believe more Rodeo competitors wear Resistol than Stetson; not sure but I believe I read that somewhere.
summary: frequently better because though Stetson still has great hats

reviewText: Was not at all what I ordered don't be fooled the beads were plastic and looked poorly made

This was one out of about 10-15 gothic victorian-looking pieces I ordered from Yazilind, and overall, I'm very happy with all of them. I'll be honest that I was worried with a larger order of so many small items that the seller might forget one or two items when shipping, but they were all there when I got the parcel. Some of them do need a smidge of DIY TLC. Have some superglue ready in case of pieces falling off (trust me, pieces will never fall off again). Really, though, even with a little assembly needed for SOME of Yazilind's products (only 3 out of the 10-15 I ordered even needed any altering), you're getting some very nice jewelry for the price! I get compliments on my bracelets, necklaces, and wrist cuffs all the time! It's my little secret that they were less than $5 each! The only part of the pieces I received I didn't like was that the bracelets are lobster clamps - so hard to get on by yourself! I feel like pull ties would be much more manageable, and probably look better, too. I will probably find some threads for them and replace the metal chains on the bracelets with pulls instead when I get the chance. Other than those few small complaints, all the items I received from Yazilind were as pictured, comfortable, and very charming. I'd definitely suggest this item as well as other similar pieces in Yazilind's collection.

I would recommend it, just be aware that you are buying a cheaper necklace. It still looks nice, but it's not the best quality item.

reviewText:
These are not your grampa's Crotons of yore, made of precious alloys and Swiss movement.  Like many watchmakers, they've gone plebeian to stay alive, if not necessarily relevant.  These are of Chinese sourced case and Japanese movement, perfectly functional, if not bit vanilla in styling.  The dial is fairly large, so if you don't like big watches, don't get this one.  I do wish the case was bit smaller but for 10 ducats, it's not bad, not bad at all ... clean lines, thin and light, decent leather strap.  $30 watch for $10 on Amazon ... good deal.

reviewText: It arrived sooner than I expected. Quality of the chain was not as good as I hoped.

I received this item on time and it is good quality, however, I didn't get the items noted as they were listed in the grouping.  I contacted the seller who was very apologetic and offered substitutions.  I was initially impressed with the customer service.  I sent in my list of missing items and substitutions for the one unavailable item.  They indicated they would ship them.  After a little while of not seeing anything, I contacted them again.  They responded that they forgot, understandable for Christmas season and I didn't need it until a spring birthday.  They were going to ship right away.  Now, months later, my contact to them gets the response that the order is over 90 days old.  Repeated emails over the last two weeks go without response.  I am very disappointed in what I thought was a great find.  At this point, if the order is corrected as promised early on, I would still use this seller because the items are very cute and good value.  I will update my review for final resolution.

I can't say I would recommend this, but if you do just be on the look out for a bent ring.

Nice lighter easy to use.  Is in my emergency bag so I will always have a lighter for fires if needed.

Purchased through Amazon Jan. 2, 2014,  Two very good videos on YouTube demonstrate how to use & service the match. [...] & [...]

The match ships dry so, you need to pick up some lighter fluid or Naphtha (the stuff they use for lighter fluid).  If you live in California, you might have trouble finding it.  I ordered a quart of VMandP Naphtha from Amazon.  It should last forever. Can also be used for cleaning auto parts & clothes spots. This is not a butane lighter.

The match is lightweight, easy to use, reliable, & easy to carry in your pocket since it has no sharp edges or corners like some other permanent matches do.

The only problem I encountered was the little "O" ring broke after a few uses.  I can't deduct any stars because it was probably my fault & it's an easy fix.  I may have gorilla twisted it when I screwed it back in the reservoir. .To it's credit, it did not leak even without the "O" ring.  I recommend this match to anyone thinking about buying one.
summary: Great For Bug Out Bag, Camping, Hiking, Disaster Kit

reviewText: hat is not deep enough.  looks kind of weird. If you have somewhat of a larger dome than normal this hat isn't for you by far. Also too much velcro on it.

This Brooklyn band formed in the summer 1968. At the time they were one of the few bands with a girl and guy up front. The group had an average age of 19 years old. After being seen playing live by Tommy James he wanted to produce and write a record for the group. The record Tighter Tighter was a hit by August 1970. The band quickly wrote an album. Most of the songs are stage arrangements and some run longer then nesasary, but do show a unique style with five members who could sing. It is a great example of 1970s evolution in music as it departed from the 60s. The album was completed in one week and the producer could have taken a little more time, but Roulette Records was not a company to invest money. Unique songs like Kentucky Fire and Hitter Man have a heavy quality that could have had better production. The band had no say on the sound of the songs. The only Quality production is Tighter Tighter, and it's the only song produced by Tommy James. The band still performs with 2 original members 43 years later. Reviewed 6/13/13
A side note. The original keyboard player married Donna Summer

The one problem though, which turned out to be a plus for me, was the colors of the suit. I don't know about you, but I saw a suit that had more pastel looking colors: lavender and sea-foam/light blues. I almost didn't buy the suit because I thought the colors were a little boring, but decided to make the purchase based on the price.
In reality the colors are more vibrant. What looks like lavender is actually a hot pink to fuchsia range and the light blue/sea-foam is a teal green. I think the color difference makes the suit much cuter and younger looking. They are a great contrast with the white background and will look great with your tan skin!

These are the second pair of these exact boots I've purchased.  I just love them.  The chestnut color goes with almost everything I wear.  I am 5'6" and they come to just below my knees.  They stay up on my legs throughout the day, and I do have thicker calves and they go over my jeans and leggings nicely.  Sometimes if my pants are thicker, I will zip them down and pull them over and zip them back up, but most times I can just pull them right on.  These boots also stand up great in cold and wet conditions.  I have been at festivals where it was rainy, muddy with lots of puddles and my feet stayed nice and dry the whole time, and I can easily wipe the boots clean when I need to.

The only reason why I had to get a new pair is b/c I caught the sole of the shoe on something as I was squatting down and accidentally put all my weight on it, and it came apart from the shoe, but they were already 2 years old at that point, so I don't fault the manufacturing. The sole wasn't intended to take that kind of pressure pulling it away from the shoe.
summary: My most favorite boots of all time!!

These jeans are super skinny but have good stretch that does not feel tight or confining. They are a little on the long side since I am only 5'3"; but I will fold or tuck them to my liking. I purchased them in a 32 originally, but the waist was too big; exchanged for the 31 instead of a 30 because of the fit in the hips.

reviewText: We purchased this for our son for Christmas, because he really liked them in shop displays.  We got the first one just in time for Christmas, but the watch face frame was cracked.  Amazon's awesome return policy was great.  They sent a box quickly with the postage sticker and it went well.  We got a replacement just in time for Christmas.  All was great, but the next day he took it in for the watch band to be adjusted to his size, the watch repair shop noticed a screw was missing.  We should have sent it back, but the watch company offered to send it to their corporate office to replace the screw which is not a normal one that they stock.  When the watch came back repaired, he got to wear it a couple days, then the same screw on the opposite side of the face frame apparently came loose and fell out while walking, so it was lost.  We've gone to numerous e watch shops and none carry these screws, so now we have to probably send it back again.  Very sad, because our son really loves the look of the watch and just wants to be able to wear it.

I unfortunately ordered this before reading reviews.  So when it arrived today--after I read reviews--I decided to measure it and give everyone an accurate idea of size.  This includes ONLY the actual cap area that fits over the head, not the ears or the horns.

Bottom, lying flat, from side to side: 8 inches.
Rounded top, lying flat, side to side: 6 inches.

Which means it's 16 inches around at the bottom; and 12 inches around at the top.

Otherwise, it's well-made and quite cute!  You just need to size it accordingly for the child's head.  Ain't no way it's for a newborn, and probably not for a toddler.  But if you hang onto it long enough, the child will grow into a very cute hat.
summary: Very Large, But Adorable!  Measurements Below.

Great product

This is a good $60 suit. Here are the facts:

- It's Paul Lorenzo suit
- It's off black, which means, it's not the darker black, but about 95% on the black hue scale, more towards brown - this means when seen at light, it's still black, but not as dark. This is due to the material
- Material is the scratchy sort of material. Polyester and Rayon.  I like this material, because it's comfortable without getting hot.
- Inside is lined with black and red trims

Initial fit:
- Good. Jacket top fit well. But at 48 Regular, it was smaller than 46 Regular fit. But plenty of room in the arms, and good for athletic build. Me and my relatively wide shoulders fit in well.
- The arm will be little longer  - for me anyway.
- Pants had enough materials to cut it correctly, which is how the suits usually come, pre tailored.
- It doesn't have any fancy stuff like on the expensive suit, but it wasn't built that bad.
- 48 Regular suit pants came to about 37" - 38" waist. A tight one at that.

I've spent about $70 tailoring it with a professional tailor.

After Fit

Forgot about this: Note: Jacket Pants have 6" drop.  Ouch. This basically means, even after you tailor it, if you don't wear this up on your belly button, your pants are going to feel like MC Hammer's pants, because all of the materials that's there. Most you can take off is about 1/2" before the tailor has to rebuild your pockets, and re-make the pants (basically).

Everything else fit very well.

This is a good, cheap suit for me to have on reserve just in case. It's a nice suit to go out drinking in, because I wouldn't really care what happens to it (if it gets out of hand, which it usually does).  Plus, it's a good beater suit.

Not great, but not bad, especially at the price.

Obviously, you're going to advertise to the world that this suit is $60 or so, because guys who knows suits will know, but most people wouldn't think twice about it.

First and foremost -- these suits run SMALL!  I have had experience ordering suits from China, and other Asian countries, and more oft than not, the sizes run much smaller than they do in the US.  I am 32D - 27 - 38 (130lbs).  So I had to order a large for my hips & it fits great!  It doesn't cut into my sides or my rear cheeks.  The top is slightly large for me, but not too bad.  I actually like that the neck strap isn't super strong -- they tend to hurt my neck anyways.

This is a GREAT buy for the money.  I got tones of compliments on the suit!  I have ordered 3 more in other colors.  Just be aware if you have hips and butt to order up in size!  If you are any larger than a size 8 -- this suit will most likely not fit you.

Like others have said, the top does run a bit big, but since I have wide hips and big behind, I had to go with the large size just to fit the bottoms. With just a little sewing I was able to get the top just the right size to stay on without looking too tight. Plus it's nice that the top has some padding to help cover and conceal. I'm happy with it, it works for the costume I need it for.

These powders make enough gatorade drink to fill a 750ml (standard size) water bottle.

I didn't understand the benefits of gatorade until my doctor friend told me about it. He always drank gatorade religiously after an intense cardio workout. The body loses not only much needed minerals and fluids, but it loses much of electrolytes that helps to maintains the body's water balance. Drinking gatorade will not only replenish the minerals, but it is also just about the best way to cure dehydration since much of Gatorade will be retained by your body.

If you are suffering from dehydration (or causes of dehydration such as diarrhea or vomitting), then drinking Gatorade will prove highly beneficial to your body's need to retain water.

I highly recommend these sticks. They take out the cumbersome process of carrying heavy bottles of Gatorade.

I love this stuff, and not many brick and mortar stores nearby sell it. So, I was going to buy a few boxes. 5, maybe. But not once I saw the $45 shipping charge for standard shipping for these items! Seriously, for that kind of money, I could take a taxi to the store in the next town over that sells these, and still come out way ahead. I'm not sure why amazon allows sellers to get away with this.

I run all the time and like this because it allows me to keep hydrated and easily replenish fluids lost during training.  It's easy to take with you and mix with water you already have.  Love it for when I'm traveling.

This is a very nice men's band. We both liked it a lot, but he found it was a little too "shiny". The facets of the ring make it more reflective than other smooth men's rings. It catches the light quite a bit, which was too much for his taste. If the surface was matte or polished I think he would have liked it better. Otherwise it's a very nice ring!

How durable is your love?  Is it soft and pliable like Element 79 (Gold), with a melting point of only 1064 degrees C?  Or is it tough and durable like Element 74, Tungsten, with a melting point of 3422 degrees C?  It sure seems like Tungsten represents a durable long lasting love better than gold!

Yes, Tungsten is not just for lightbulb filaments, drill bits, and welding electrodes, but actually makes a reasonably attractive wedding band.  Especially for a man who might be a little rougher on his ring, the tungsten alternative is attractive, durable, and inexpensive.  This particular band is well made and comfortable to wear.  I actually like other tungsten bands I have seen, but really did not like the style of this one.  The outside of it is faceted, and the effect just makes the ring look too shiny and glitzy.  I'd prefer my ring to be more subdued - this one was so shiny it almost looked just cheap.

In addition, this particular manufacturer does not make half-size rings.  Since my ring size is 8.25, my size 9 ring ended up being way too big on me.  A size 8 would be too small, and tungsten rings are hard to cut off (just ask an emergency room doctor), so I didn't want to get stuck in it!  The problem is that with the high melting point, they cannot be resized either.

So if you'd like a durable wedding band and you fit well into a whole size ring, you can consider this ring.  However, if you don't like a glitzy and shiny style, it might not be for you either.  I'd recommend looking at other bands instead.

Note: A free sample was provided to me by the distributor for evaluation with no promise of a positive review.
summary: Tungsten wedding bands are nice but this faceted design really doesn't do much for me - also not available in half sizes

I Went into my new beautiful bag for some blistex, pulled the flap down and closed it.  Only, it didn't close.  Or so I thought.  Apparently, it had closed, but the patent leather portion of the flap detached itself from the cheap cardboard "lining" it was glued to.  This would have been a good buy had I gotten it for about five dollars.  I've been bamboozled!!

I love this belt, and have gotten multiple complements from people both for the Breaking Bad inspiration and from people who have never seen a seatbelt belt. The stitching and materials are top notch. The belt feels just like a seatbelt (but a bit thinner and softer) and the clip is solid metal and gives a definitive "click" when closed. My only complaint is that after a few days of wear it starts to loosen so you will need to re-tighten it every now and again. The other thing is that it does get a little annoying threading it through a pair of paints, but you get used to it. Very minor annoyances on a cool belt that any BB fan would love.
summary: Great Belt for You, or the BB Fan in Your Life

While the product itself looked really nice,  I was disappointed.  I ordered the 35mm x 20mm first and it was way to small for me. I liked the cross shown here very much.  The contrast of the black and the gold was beautiful and different, and would draw the eye to the figure of Jesus.  At the time it was $500, more than I was willing to pay, but when I saw it for $197 I wanted to buy it.  I briefly considered the "14K Yellow Gold & Black Enamel Crucifix Cross Mens Pendant" because it's bigger and seems to have the same picture, but the cross with onyx would be higher quality than the one with enamel.  The cross I got was a disappointment.  The "onyx" is a thin plate that I didn't find attractive.  It does not have the little holes at the four ends of the cross.  Looking at it from the side, the beams seemed to have some depth, but turning it over one sees that the cross is of a thin plate that is molded to give the appearance of depth.  The back is open; there's no cover on the back to make it hollow, but closed.  I expected to see "14K" on the back, but it is not there.  So the cross is small and lightweight.  It didn't seem to me to be worth anything near $197, much less $500.
summary: I liked the cross shown here very much
