reviewText: They are so comfortable,, I love them!  The fit is good, too.  They seem true to size.  Great jeans!  Thanks.

Okay..I've always had problems when shopping for pants. I cannot tell you the amount of tears I have shed while walking out of stores because I couldn't find a pair of pants that fit my body type. Years and years of this have passed and I stumble upon this brand of jeans. From the pictures the jeans looked perfect. They were flared, which the majority of stores I know of don't sell anymore because that's not the style to wear these days, they looked like they came to the right spot on the belly and the reviews weren't scary or off putting. So I crossed my fingers, wished upon a star,  threw imaginary salt over my shoulder and took a chance in ordering these jeans. When my jeans came in the mail I was a little hesitant to put them on. I got myself prepared for disappointment...I took a deep breath, put my feet in and was expecting to do my usual "Pants Dance" to wiggle them up past my hips. And I could not believe it...NO PANTS DANCE! They slid right up my legs, past my hips and went straight to their designated spot on my waist. No sucking in to button or zip them and infact..they were about a size TOO BIG! From the reviews I read, I was prepared and ordered them a size smaller than what I usually wear. And even with me ordering a size smaller..they were still a little big. But it was an easy 5 minute fix with my sewing machine and they ended up being PERFECT! In fact...I just received my second pair that I recently ordered because I recently lost a lot of weight and I don't want to go to any other pants. I love them!!
I ordered these to be "inspiration pants" for me to lose enough weight to fit in them. Well..looks like I'll need to order another pair because my inspiration pants ended up fitting me perfectly. And a little added bonus..the way the back of the pants are made make your butt look FANTASTIC!! I put them on and showed my husband my new pants. I have NEVER seen his eyes pop out of his head that far before! He may love them a little big more than I do. lol But with all the good there is 1 thing I CAN complain about. My only complaint is that the material on my 2nd pair (Mariah) seemed a little bit thinner than my 1st pair (Katy). Besides that..I'm super happy and would recommend these pants to everyone.
Fit's like a glove!!! Make's me look AMAZING!!! I get ton's of compliments!!! One of the most comfortable pair of jeans I've ever owned!!!
summary: More perfect then I could have dreamed!!!

reviewText: its not ankle lengh, it went to the knees.  Sent back

This wallet was a Christmas gift for my husband.  After years of being a double fold type of guy, we loves this new trip-fold wallet.  He especially likes how like weight it is and that it fits better in his pocket.

I've been buying / using wallets for decades, and finally chose this to try out. I've been looking for a way to slim down my wallet and have looked at many, and read dozens of reviews. When this new Allett Lux was just announced, I decided to give it a try - and couldn't be more pleased. It's the size of my passport book, and appears to be beautifully made. Very nice leather with turned and well stitched edges and reinforced corners (extra stitching), and the wallet is lined in rip stop nylon. The design of the wallet is every bit as functional as has been described by Allett - and it's perfect. I have 12 cards in the wallet now, including credit cards, global entry card (in its own RFID blocking envelope), insurance cards, drivers license and car registrations and a couple of pictures of my kids. It all fits nicely - easy in and out, but nothing falls out. The wallet remains slim and flat, looks elegant, and is surprisingly easy to handle and use throughout the day -- it took me all of 5 mins to get used to holding he wallet differently than my old bifold when I take out cards or cash. The large opening at the top is divided -- a shallower side is perfect for bills, and the other side is the full depth of the wallet is great for receipts. I'm on day 3 with this, and and I'm extremely pleased. No more wallet bulge - fits front and back pants pockets and lays flat -- dress pants or jeans, and fits my suit jacket lapel pocket perfectly as well.

I'm extremely pleased with this. If it holds up well over time, this will easily become my favorite wallet.

Update - after 2 years of use, June 30, 2017:

I've been using this wallet daily for the past 2 years since writing the original review. The wallet still looks great, and has held up well. All seams are intact, all linings are still in place, and the wallet still looks great. I've gotten in the habit of flipping it over periodically, so both sides get about equal time facing in toward me in my pocket and facing out. This has kept the wallet from assuming any particular curvature, so it still lays nice and flat.

Overall - it's virtually like new. The ONLY issue I've had is that after two years, I'm finding that some of the cards (e.g., my Drivers License) tend to get a bit stuck in the wallet when their smooth plastic surface is up against the leather interior inside a card slot and the whole thing gets pressed together sitting in my pocket for hours on end. I didn't notice this over the first year -- not sure if it's the leather getting sticky, or the drivers license itself, or a result from me having several cards in each slot these days. Not a big deal, as it just takes a wiggle occasionally to get the cards to slide out.

The only visible wear is a bit of curvature on the edges (to be expected), and where cards have embossed numbers, they have tended to impress themselves a bit on the leather, as can be seen in the photo I'm adding to the review. But the photo actually exaggerates this -- this is virtually invisible without the camera. Note - this is the wallet after two years of daily use.

After decades of buying wallets -- including very expensive / high end leather goods from Italy and the like, this is, without question, still my favorite wallet. I have zero interest at this point in looking at other wallets, and I still marvel that so few companies have adopted a similar design, as this is virtually perfect.

Highly recommended.
summary: Best wallet I've owned - brilliant design - excellent execution

I ordered a medium because I had ordered a large with another suit (as people were saying to order up and it was way too big. The suit is cure, but a little tighter on the bottom than I would prefer. But I would imagine you would want it on the tighter side as you want the bottoms to stay up. So, I think the best option here is to loose 5 pounds. I'm giving my exact measurements as I know how useless height and weight is with swimsuits. I have a smaller torso, for someone who is 5'7". 38"B, 31"W,38"H. The bottoms would fit perfect for 35-37.5" hips. The vender was wonderful. They emailed me right away to let me know they did not have the color I ordered. They gave me several other options, or the option to be refunded. I ordered the B&W polka dots, but let them know that timing was important to me and only wanted to order if they could still get me the suit by the end of the week. They sent me a confirmation, letting me know they were changing my shipping to next day and I got the suit earlier then needed! Good material, great service and an overall really good deal. I should point out that the material is high quality, but there is not a lot of support for the girls, that is not that important to me, but if it were I would have to make some modifications or get another suit.

I fell in love with the color scheme, design and price. It arrived on time as promised too. My issue with this swimsuit is that it won't fit over my breasts properly. I wear a 36-B and even after I removed the padding, it still didn't fit over my breasts properly. My breasts are not that big and now I have a swimsuit that I can't even wear.

reviewText: I bought these as my first pair of thigh high socks.  I have lupus and when I get cold I am in pain for days and am looking for cute ways to stay warm.  I could not find enough reviews from people with my body type so here is mine.  I am 5'2/5'3ish, 152lbs and kinda curvy.  I wear a size 10/12 pant and 7.5/8 shoe.  These can be pulled all the way up to my bum.  They are snug on the widest part of my thigh which for me is about 3 inches down from how high I can pull them so the tight top part of the band doesn't cut off my circulation, but they are noticeably snug.  If you wear larger than a size 12 pant I don't see them being very comfortable.  They are thick and tight from toe to thigh, when I try rolling them down to right above the knee it was very uncomfortable.  I will be getting several more pairs as they are good quality and I'm certain with regular wear they will relax a bit :)

reviewText:
Was debating giving the miracle suit islander 3 stars or 4 stars & ended up giving it 4, because the issue i had with it was very taste specific and may suit someone else well. In fact i almost kept it. I tried the size 12 and the size 14 & i found that indeed i needed the sz 14, which is what i need in most swimsuits so i'd say it runs true.

My skirts are size 14, tops L -10-12 & i am 5'4" & 145ish lbs.bra size 38D generally. This provided room for the bust, a problem i have encountered in most suits was not enough room for my chest even though i am not that big. And as far as dealing with my tummy area... My problem spot, it was not bad. Quite nicely camouflaged. And 'twas quite shapely.

I took off one star because that lopsided look made me appear, well, lopsided. I realize that was the "look", but i found two other suits (from the same seller), that provided similar coverage without that off center factor so i kept those (the "skater style, in which i did need a size 12 & the one called "swimdress" in sz 14, a little longer, but great coverage).

Otherwise, this honestly isn't a bad choice. Decent bust support and coverage and the "skirt" did not come down too low at all on that one side, the other side not at all.
summary: it was not bad. Quite nicely camouflaged

reviewText: The lower body of the suit fits well and has nice compression. The upper body feels flimsy, though. The cups need some lining or better shaping and the straps are too long even on the shortest adjustment and too stretchy. I have a very short torso and yet this suit felt like the cups were situated too low, i.e. the strength of stretch and compression around the middle pulled them down without the countermeasure of strong straps to pull them up. The underwire is also not very secure in its channel. I keep having to sew it back in (meaning there is too much stress on the fabric at the cups). I wear the suit to work out, but it is not the pretty vacation suit I'd hoped for.
I would buy it again. As a matter of fact I did buy two more of type.

Sometimes having rain jackets with zippers and make the jacket feel cheap if they are small and cheap which easily breaks, but that is not this type of jacket.  You will be thoroughly impressed with this jacket for the reasonable price and I would strongly recommend this jacket if you want a good thick quality type of rain jacket and one that you won't be throwing away after using a few times.

reviewText:

composite frame
composite lens
non-polarized
Lens width: 55 millimeters
Original Case
Original Packaging

I was surprised once i have received the Sunglasses that they were actually POLARIZED contrary to what was published above.

I intend to return and exchange the sunglasses with another Oliver People NON-POLARIZED type.

Brief (size medium/6). Very comfortable, provides good support, attractive (would have liked aqua, but not incl. in assortment), appears well made.
Fits very well (at least on me) - not baggy, waist band fits well; leg openings with wide elastic don't pinch; wider gusset (3" vs 2.5") allows more room.
Durability - too early to tell (only washed once); no holes or rips (as delivered)
A bit warm for hot weather wear; prefer something lighter for summer.
Thus far, a good value @ roughly $3 a pair.
Purchased 2nd assortment (got the aqua this time); same quality & fit.
Have washed original items several times (machine wash, rack dry), no defects to date.

Update Dec 2017
After approx. 6 months, the left seam opened up at the waist band on 3 of 12 pair.
All defects were in the same location; no defects in other seams.  Not limited to any particular color.
Easily repaired with a few stitches to stop the seam from unravelling. No further problems.
Still very satisfied with the product.
Love them!

I am a guy and wear a size 5 panty. Ordered medium and they are perfect. Had others before I lost a lot of weight and needed new panties. If the larger size weren't worth it, I would not have gotten these. Recommended for everyone. Much more comfortable than men's underwear. Love them. Thanks.

Out of the pack of 6 only 4 fit perfectly, 2 are too small (one black one, one white one). I wear size 6 and ordered medium. I like the fit (of the 4 that do fit) and quality of the panties. They are maybe a bit heavier than I'd like, but I could live with that.
What I can't live with is the horrible waist band. It is rigid, hard to the touch, and about 3 times wider than is needed. While the band has "give", what doesn't have give is the thread that was used to sew it on to the panties. I washed one pair, hoping the waist band might soften, but that didn't happen. On the positive side, I put them in the dryer and there was no shrinkage. I am trying to replace my PERFECT Hanes satin panties (64% polyester, 31% nylon, 5%Spandex) it seems they have disappeared off the face of this earth. My search continues.
A couple of readers wrote there was a strong odor. I noticed the grey pair has a strong odor, but nothing too bad. Someone else mentioned there was no cotton crotch, but all 6 I received have cotton crotches.
Bottom line, 1/3 doesn't fit, the waist band makes them unwearable.
Waisted my money!

this is probally the best boot for comfort and safty ive ever had i work in afganastan and do alot of walking on uneven surfaces and rocky terrain im standing most of the day working on helicopters the sole is super slip resistant on oil, fule and other fluids comfortable right out of the box and i wear them 6 days a week i can usually get 6 months to a year out of a set of these boots the old style of the same boot had a harder sole and would last a little longer 2 years out of one set at 5 days a week the softer sole is more comfortable but usually cracks across the flex point in the middle letting ground water in through the sole i haven't found any boot as safe as this one so far and ive tried quite a few pair in the last 20 years of aviation mech work

Me and my son are great fans of GOT, I ordered the shirt for his 21st birthday. Of course, I have read also all the customers reviews, how awesome and soft it is etc. As I needed it fast, the shipping to Slovakia was twice as much as the price of the item. What I got was absolutely different from what was in the picture, only the printing was the same. The shirt was ugly, extremely large, baggy, square shape, wide sleeves, did not fit to the body at all. It became clear when I noticed the tag was also different from that which was in one of the web photos. So I wrote to the seller with a return request and demanded my money back (sent them also the photos). They were willing to refund the price of the shirt but not the shipment (which was over 20 dollars !!!) and were so "kind" to let me keep the shirt. Their argument was I should not have purchased on the base of customers reviews and they said they had the right to change the brand.
After that I claimed directly at amazon.com and insisted on my statement that I  got a different product from that I had ordered and sent them the pictures to prove that. After that they apologized and promised to refund also the shipment charge so I hope I will get it soon back. I also believe amazon will investigate this seller and undertakes proper measures against this seller and his misleading practices.

reviewText:
I scoured these reviews looking for someone who would actually post their measurements and then the results of how the dress fit. It seems I kept finding that it would fit up to a size 12. Well I'm a curvy size 14, at 5'6" and 175-180 pounds. I am a 38C w 44" hips.
After seeing the skinny little model on the YouTube videos (show some great ways to wear the dress but shes a veritable clothes hanger) and in pictures I was concerned about having enough fabric to cover my full figure on top.
I do have to put the dress on over my head, but it works beautifully for a full figure. I would say that you should probably buy the tube top if you aren't comfortable going braless. There are some backless strapless bras that will work too. Tube top or not, the scarf style top has plenty of fabric to cover a full figure without leaving that horrible side boob then nobody wants to see...
At my height the dress does drag the ground a bit but with the unfinished edge you could always cut it if you wanted to. I have left it because it looks great and flows beautifully. The fabric is thin but not ultra see through with a print, though I can imagine if you purchase this in nude or yellow or white it would be.
Even with my size, the dress does not curve back in around the hips, it's more of an A-line maxi...which is great!  Like it so much I am buying 2 more!
Also...this gress is great for travel...doesn't wrinkle easily!
These dresses were perfect for my bridesmaids! And the price could not be beat!

reviewText: Spice Fontana print is an absolutely gorgeous pattern with lots of purple in it, which is not really visible from the photo. The material feels great on the skin and transforms in a lovely way. It will take you a little practice to tie it in a way that doesn't show the back side of the fabric (which is not printed), but once you get the hang of it, you'll love it. However, its seems that some dresses differ in quality -- it's worth mentioning that I also ordered this dress in the Aqua Renaissance print, which was a noticeably thinner fabric and the color in the photo was a bit off from reality (more sky blue and less vivid turquoise).

First off, I ordered this with the intentions of wearing this transformer dress from VonVonni for a wedding I am apart off in September. While I received this dress by the expected delivery date [thanks to Amazon Prime], that was the only good thing about this online purchase. I ordered the Gold Metallic VonVonni Women's Transformer Dress, not the gold with the animal print, just the regular one. The description of Gold Metallic with the picture of the gold metallic dress was nothing like the product that was sent to me. There's nothing shimmery gold or gold metallic about the dress I received. The dress I received was more of a champagne color and small gold glitter. It didn't look nice when I opened the bag it was sent in, but I tried it on hoping it'd look decent on. Unfortunately, it wasn't even decent looking when I tried it on. I'm a size US 4 or EU8 in most brands and even I found this to be way to big for me, I don't know how anyone smaller me (like a size 2 and smaller) could work with this dress especially when this dress is meant for anyone that are within the size range of 0-12 (one size fits all). I'm most disappointed about the color of the dress not being what the description on the webpage states it to be. I'm also unhappy with how they cut part of the dress too, if you've read the other reviews about this types of dress from VonVonni good or bad, you figure that the dress not hemmed at all, which is understandable seeing this dress is suppose to be convertible, however parts of the dress I received was cut so badly that you could see wear they stopped and started a new cut in the fabric (very sloppy looking). Due to those issues, I sent the dress back indubitably to VonVonni, I did not like the dress VonVonni sent me.
Although I've only had negative things to say about the dress I received, I can honestly say that the actually fabric felt nice (had good weight to it, jersey-like material) and was decent for the price they charge. I don't believe that this dress is nice in the lighter colors (like the one I ended up getting) because of the fabric there's a risk of it being see through and/or you will be able to see any flaws in craftsmanship if any. But I think the dress could be worn beautifully in the darker colors and the brighter colors options (flaws will be less noticeable and the fabric would look better in those types of colors). Wished that this dress was in the right gold metallic color and better crafted, I could have saved money, however I'll look elsewhere and spend more for quality.

It's also pretty soft. It's not scratchy or cheap-feeling, it feels a little more expensive than it really is, which I find nice.

When I wash it, I just throw it in with all my regular clothes and it turns out just fine. I don't bother with washing it on delicate or anything. Sometimes it does get caught on hooks of other clothes and jewelry and such, so you should probably be careful about that.

reviewText: I'm 5-11 and these pants are wonderful.  Heavier than the texere pajamas (which I adore) and fit great.  I'll be buying 3 more pair and more tees.  Excellent clothing  for hanging around the house or nearby errands.

I bought two pair: black and air force blue (a greenish blue).

PROS:
1. Comfortable. I sized up because I was going for around-the-house comfort and I have a sensitive waist. Fine as pj bottoms.
2. Washes well. I followed instructions and they came out fine.
3. Nice thin, stretchy material. I don't get why some reviewers called these heavy or too warm.
4. Pockets. They're patch pockets and not big or sturdy enough for anything heavy (e.g., phone or wallet), but I always welcome pockets.

CONS:
1. Clearly the length is inconsistent, based on the reviews I've read. Mine, which are size XL, had a 32-inch inseam before washing and drying (per instructions) and 31 inches after. A little shrinkage in length is to be expected. I'm 5'5" and for me they're a tad long as barefoot pj's/lounge pants. That also makes them problematic for yoga class.
2. Long rise, at least in this size, which contributes to them dragging on the floor.
3. Cheap drawstring construction: You can see the white elastic band through the raw holes for the string (which doesn't match the pants color).

$29 is the upper limit of what I'd pay for these pants. The gray ones are currently going for $39, and that's a definite no. Overall these pants are what I was looking for, and I'm glad I bought them.
These are great pants for lounging about in winter. Soft, comfortable, and warm. I wish they were a little longer (I am 5'8") but since I'm not going anywhere, that's a tolerable shortcoming.

The reason it's One Size Fits Most is because it comes with a little piece of padding which you can adhere inside the hat band and make it fit more snugly.  So it is a little large on me, and I installed the padding, and it fits okay.  Not like it would if it was sized specifically for me.  As far as what to wear it with... originally I got it to wear with a pink outfit, but I find that pinks are ridiculously hard to match and vary widely based on the material used.  This is kind of a baby pink, and the pink outfit is more of a bubblegum pink.  So I don't wear them together.  This goes great with baby blue or seafoam green!
I wear this hat when I'm camping. It keeps a perfect temperature and it is really; warm soft and comfortable.

At the first wearing, it did seem snug as I was putting it on, but now I realize that its supposed to. Its almost like a compression garment, thats how powerful the Lycra is in this suit - which is wonderful for a fitness swimsuit. I suppose if you were getting it more for a recreational/leisure swimsuit, it would seem too tight and youd want to size up.  But I like the suit and the brand so much, that I have purchased another Aquabelle suit - this time in my regular size!
summary: Perfect suit for water aerobics or fitness swimming!

reviewText: My husband really liked how lightweight it is and how it provided good shade.

Love this one! This is my main/only sunglasses while driving! Tried a few other ones, but this one is what I liked the most by way of functionality, and looks, and it of course comes at a good price too.

Apart from giving me 100% UV protection, and being polarized, what I love is the semi-rimless look! Makes it look good and stylish and fits nicely over prescription glasses. They are not too big too, so fit on face like regular sunglasses and do not look like they are sitting on top of myopia glasses. Vision is quit sharp. I have tried it even in low light conditions - example tunnels, sudden shade while driving with setting sun on face, etc, and works very well. Not too dark, just perfect :) If you are looking for wrap around or fit over sunglasses, I would suggest you give this one a try. Duco customer service responses are also fast - ask them a question and you get a quick answer, and they have a good returns policy too. So, you cannot go wrong!
summary: Great product, very stylish, very good sunglasses for wearing over prescription eyeglasses.

reviewText:
These work very well for their intended purpose.  They are of pretty good quality, especially for the price paid.  I use these as a backup in case I can't find my prescription sunglasses.

I know... these look strange... not a brand you are familiar with... kind of a high price point... I get it!  However, the darn things are awesome.  I bought these on Saturday and my first run in them was the Portland Rock 'n' Roll Half Marathon the next morning.  No break in, nothing.  I ran in 1:59, which is good for a 52 year old 220 pound runner.  The course was hilly and demanding.  The next day my legs were sore, but not my joints!!!  I could write more than you want to read about the plush nature of the shoe and how than encourage a mid-foot strike, but that would be tiresome.  If you want a highly cushioned shoe that will allow you to run more miles in comfort, this is it.  These are very much a neutral shoe.  I have tried almost every shoe on the market.  These will be the only shoes I run half marathons in.  They are excellent.

I was disappointed.  They are certainly not polished and are not very substantial at all.  The metal is kind of thin and gives the impression that they won't last too long.  The only reason I didn't returned them is that it would probably would cost as much to ship them back as I paid for them.  Will not recommend

The costume is adorable, but not perfect. Overall, I think it is well worth the price!

reviewText: I'm so happy that the actual wig is the one shown in the picture! Everything is the same, the color, the messy bangs  (which is fine. They need to be cut, but the picture accurately depicts them.), the length, and the gorgeous curls are all accurate. The wig is very thin however and you can see the netting, but thats expected for the price. The cap is also very large which is great if you have lots of hair to put under the wig, it's really comfy! (My natural hair is about 40" long. Usually stuffing all of my hair into a wig is really painful. But this wig doesn't feel tight at all!). I'm very happy with it, the shipping being prime was also a nice perk! My friend will love this for her princess bubblegum cosplay!

I received this order so fast I was amazed. It's super long and beautiful, the bangs are so soft, some people mistaked it for my real hair! Love it, it gets tangled easily but I mean what hair doesn't right?

reviewText: Comfort and style great boot. Very nice looking.

Okay, I'm a very patient person and always offer the benefit of a doubt but, this time I was annoyed to the point that I wasn't even excited about getting this product in the mail. That is a first. A list of things that I'd like to point out as to why I'm not satisfied with my purchase:
1. I ordered this item with a whole lot of other much bigger items at one time. This was a Valentines gift for my soon to be mother-in-law. I ordered it in enough time but just received it today. 11 days later when it was a prime item and showed 2 day delivery.
2. Weather conditions were somewhat bad but not to where one couldn't mail out a necklace. I received the rest of my order and one of the items was an office desk and a chair.
3. The seller kept emailing me that it was on its way when in fact it was sitting in their warehouse.
4. If a desk and chair can make it in such "bad weather conditions", I'm sure a tiny necklace could.
5. It also looked nothing close to the image displayed and is cheaply made.
6. A complete waste of time.

Amazon, don't worry! You're still awesome!
summary: Not amused or pleased by this necklace nor seller.

reviewText: I thought I read enough reviews about the product before purchasing to make an informed decision. All the same size. They all fit me...except this one. Now only does this "32D" fit like a 32A, but it's just....odd. It's like it was designed by an alien who has never seen a human woman's anatomy before...or a young boy. Either way, this bra is nothing like whatever size you think you're getting. In all the years I've been ordering from Amazon, this is the first time I've ever had to return anything. I hope this process won't be a nightmare. I'll be sure to update my review once I've received my refund. I will also be leaving seller feedback, at that point.

I usually wear Medium in dresses but bought the large based on the sizing chart this Seller provided.  I had an unhappy experience once where I purchased contrary to the Seller's sizing chart and ended up with dresses that were too small.  The complete opposite occurred with this dress.  I ended up with a dress that was too LARGE.  Please do not follow the sizing chart.  If you usually wear Medium, purchase the Medium.  Whatever your usual size is, that is what you are to purchase.  Do not reach for your tape measure.  That being said, the Seller was quite gracious and promptly sent the smaller size upon the return of the item at my expense. As much as I would love to give it the whole 5 star rating, I can't because the chain broke moments after she put it on. The actual pendant was heavier than expected, (we were REALLY surprised, but in a good way, I see that as a pro) and the chain is actually a little on the flimsy side, so we just decided to use a different chain anyway. These boots are beautiful.  The red color is an orangey-reddish-brown that looks amazing with jeans and dresses.  The sole is also amazingly comfortable (especially in the ball of the foot area).  The bottom of the sole is grippy and very practical for walking, not thin like a lot of other booties.  The height is also perfect; tall enough to look classy and add a little height, but short enough to be practical for city walking, work, or casual days.  I usually wear 7.5 and that is what I ordered.  They seem to fit really well when I just put them on, but unfortunately, when I try to walk in them for a little while, my foot shifts forward so much that my toes are all crunched up at the front (which will definitely cause some mean foot cramps).  For the record, I do have a narrow heel, so that may have something to do with this issue.  So sad to be returning these.
summary: So gorgeous-- I wish they fit!!!

reviewText: This is my first review on Amazon. I usually don't bother, but this is just so incredibly absurd, that I felt it necessary to warn other potential buyers. The shoes are cheap, cheap, cheap. Not worth the ink printed on a single dollar. I was so excited to get these because I absolutely loved the style. I wore them out to dinner the very night I got them. To my dismay they fell apart (literally, the straps dislodged from the base and everything!), within a few hours of my wearing them. I am beyond perturbed. Trust me, the price may seem great, but it will be far more worth it to shell out the extra money to get a great quality pair of shoes, than to pay 30 for a pair that won't last you a single night.

If you're into fashion, bright colors or pieces that make a statement, this blazer could be it. I ordered both the white and blue blazers. I'm a regular US10, slightly curvy (bust 36" & hip 39"), ordered the large & fit is spot on. Soft, cool on the skin material, well tailored & good quality. Material is polyester with no stretch to it. This blazer is short, back-end rests right above the behind, and hence the image is slightly misleading in this aspect. I can tell the style & shape of this blazer is not made for all body types, and certainly not for short torsos, wide hips, thick arms or large busts. So, if one's body shape is short triangle, round or heavy pear, this blazer would fit awkwardly, be unflattering or not fit at all. The blazer have shoulder pads, that can be easily snipped off (which is what i did, to get a more relaxed look). Just like another reviewer mentioned, it's not comfortable rolling up the sleeves, becomes snug. The white blazer is true white with bright yellow, and the blue is more royal blue than regular blue with bright yellow. Looks great both zipped up or down. I would have preferred an inside button, and actually considering getting one tailored in. I like the versatility of this blazer which can be worn casual (with jeans, shorts) or semi-formal (with a fitted dress, pencil skirt, a-line, office pants). I'm very fond of these blazers, and would recommend them if you're looking for a fashion blazer at a very fair price, while keeping in mind observation towards body shape. (Note: you can check another equally cute but not too bright blazer, that would fit all body types http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00GYTJXGI?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0 )
summary: Versatile fashion blazer at a very fair price, not for all body types though

I finally found the side zip hoodie I was looking for.  This hoodie has the shepra-like lining in the hood, which I was looking for and the rest of the hoodie has the same thickness as you would find purchasing a hoodie from Old Navy or similar store.  The fit is long enough to cover my torso and bottom.  I also purchased two sizes up from what I would usually buy.  I'm typically a size small so I ordered a large and it fits fine.  Things to note for perspective buyers: 1: There are more than one manufacture of this same hoodie and many are different quality and price.  This one by DJT is thicker and better quality.  The hood is shepra-like and not faux fur.  The zipper is also of better quality.  The only lining is in the hood and no where else.  2.  The size still runs small but not as small as other the knock-offs of this hoodie.  Buy two sizes up and you'll be fine if you want a movable fit.  If you like it more form fitting and then buy only one size up.  3.  Everyone is using this photo to display this product but it is hard to tell which product you'll actually get from certain buyers.  I purchased this exact same hoodie from Poshmark and it was a cheaper and poor quality product.  I also paid $25 more.  The product was made by Finejo and the fabric was so thin I could see through it.  The hood lining was faux fur and the zippers where cheaply made.  The fit was also very small even though I ordered two sizes up.  I returned it right away.  4.  If you only like the look of the side zipper but don't care about thickness or quality you can buy this hoodie from Fred Meyer (if still available) for $10-12 but will only be suitable for teenagers who are only looking for style vs function.

Overall if you are looking for the better quality of this hoodie and not the cheap knock off version then buy this one by DJT.
summary: I'm typically a size small so I ordered a large and it fits fine. Things to note for perspective buyers

This hat is tacky, tacky, tacky - and I knew this when I ordered it!  First I took off the red bow since my outfit is burgundy and gold.  Next I unglued one side of the hat to make larger and more eye catching.  Next I tied black and burgundy tulle around the hat crown, ending in a big bow in the back with the tulle tails hanging down.  I glued a big bouquet of feather plumes behind the bow for added height (next to the crown with the bow covering the base of the feathers).  Next, I pinned a large burgundy fabric rose to the center front of the crown.  Last , I unglued the headband, moved the hat further down the headband and reglued.  I ended up with a super stunning pirate fascinator!

By using this inexpensive hat as a base, adding some odds and ends, my pirate hat now looks like an expensive custom  made expensive fascinator.  Excellent and I would, and will, buy this hat again.

reviewText: This is at least an inch longer than all the traditional wallets I have had.  It has so many compartments, and they even included a little change purse (I put my Tylenol in it), there is a zipper on the back for change, and you don't have to dig--you can see into it easily.  I love that it has slits to hold all your cards, and is the perfect size so that the ends of cards show so you can at a glance see which card you need--insurance, Triple AAA, prescription drug cards--all of it visible, and enough slots for all the often used ones.  There is a nice long slit for your paper money, then another slot behind that for more personal items or coupons, or whatever.  Also another zippered compartment where I put my credit cards, safe deposit box keys--important things I can't risk have falling out.  Then two clear vinyl slots you can see when you open the wallet--I put my driver's license on one side, and my SS card in the other.  This matches every purse, so no having to change wallets every time you want to carry a different colored bag.  Very well constructed.  Great value.  Highly recommend.

This is obviously a well made bag/case.  I was hoping to carry two lenses in it. That is not what it is designed to do. I am stating the obvious: This case is for storing one lens while easily allowing you to do a one handed exchange with a second one. If you want to rotate a third lens, you will need another lens case such as the Lowepro 55aw.  No two lenses combined in the 200aw will allow it to be zipped closed without a struggle which leaves the case with a slightly warped shape. Any one lens including my 75-300 mm with the case closed  or open and ready to exchange with a second lens works just fine. In other words if you use this case for what it is designed to do, you will like it a lot. If you want to store two lenses,  you won't like it as much.
summary: Can' use it exactly the way I thought I could.

reviewText: Loved this belt.  Well made and well designed.  Fit very well.  Took ALL the load off my back and made lens changeouts a snap even while walking. It came "new" but has no tags stating the size, who made it, where it came from, or what material it's made of. I purchased several of these Jomaship Watch Winders on sale.  I think it is a decent functioning watch winder and it will keep your watch wound but, it can look a little cheap and can be a bit hard to use at first.  So if you purchase this, it is only fair not to compare them to the ones that cost hundreds of dollars.
Looks:
It is plastic.  There is no see-through cover to keep out dust.  It is black and silver (maybe gray).
Use:
The directions are not good and basically just gives you the regular legal disclaimers and tells you how to turn it on and not take the watch out while the winder is on.  The winder has a center which you can affix the watch to.  You can take it out by reaching in with your thumb and index finger and squeezing the sides and gently pulling out with your fingers.  I thought this was not good for people with thicker fingers (especially with the adaptor for bigger watch faces on).  Later I found out that since the winder is slightly flimsy, you can actually just push the center to a side and the bottom on one side unhinges just enough for you to pull it out.  The center comes with a adaptor for watches with bigger dials.  You can remove this adaptor for watches with smaller dials.  Both have small velvet stickers to keep the back of the watch from scratching against the plastic directly.  You can secure your watch around this center which has a plastic piece with a spring inside that adjusts to the size of the wristband.  This watch winder turns clock-wise and counter-clockwise.  There is no setting for time variations.  The winders have been in use for a few days now and they do the job and are keeping my automatics from stopping.  I have not had to wind them so far.  They are fairly quiet except one of mine makes a slight noise when it goes clockwise.  I let it go counter-clockwise and the noise stopped.  One of the winders was defective as it would not turn, but Jomashop was quick to issue an RMA as soon as I informed them.
summary: Not for displaying just for winding.

reviewText:
First, let me start by saying this: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM FROM MACRO COMPANY!! I purchased a sit n stroll from MACRO with plenty of time to spare for an upcoming vacation. The amazon website stated it would ship in 1-2 days. MACRO did not intend on shipping it for at least 10 days! I had to cancel my order which was a disaster. The company never once returned numerous phone calls and emails I left with them. I refused delivery of the item and MACRO never credited my account for it! In the end, my credit card company had to dispute charges with them. It was a huge headache! Very dissapointing company, to say the least. We ended up using a different website to purchase the product.

  Now, let me say that I really like the sit n stroll! I used it on a vacation that I went on alone with my 14 month old. Make sure that you call ahead to the airline to see if the plane isle way is wide enough for the sit n stroll. My plane was small, so I had the pilot actually carry the sit n stroll onto the plane for me. The stroller is way to heavy to carry with one hand! I would not recommend using this item as an everyday stroller, it does not feel that sturdy. After my trip, we placed it in our second car and use it only as a car seat. It is a good item for the money. Things that I didn't like about it ... nearly impossible to lift from a carseat position into a stroller with my 23 lb. daughter inside. I needed another person's help for that. The catch on the back is sharp and I cut my hand twice trying to use it.  Also, there is really no storage space under or behind the actual seat - again, I would not recommend this as an everyday stroller.

Good product, bad vendor!!!!

reviewText: Absolutely wonderful.  The large size fit my size 13s with room to spare.  Very warm.  Great for Bed Boots, and not at all expensive.  I couldn't be more pleased.  I intend to order quite a few for Christmas presents.
This product is very large and just has 3 velcro closures so it doesn't stay on very well for a person in a wheelchair. They require additional stability closures so they don't fall off.

These things are awesome.  I have fuzzy slippers to try to keep my feet warm, but sitting at my desk near a door my ankles and calves get cold too and a blanket on my lap doesn't do enough.  These aren't socks, and they aren't slippers ... think of them as "slippers for your slippers".  I'm 5' 9" and they come up to just below my knee, and they're roomy enough to actually wear them over your normal slippers (I wear a size 8.5 and these fit nicely over a pair of Ugg type slippers).  There are 3 velco closures so they're easy to put on, and easy to tear off if you have to get up to do something.  The lining is soft and warm and the outer shell does a good job of not attracting too much dust, lint, pet hair, etc.  I haven't had mine long enough to have to wash them, but they look like they would survive a couple of trips through the washing machine when necessary.

reviewText: It's a great buy. Been told by a lot of people that it looks like a regular pair of glasses; exactly what I was looking for. Lights were amazing to look at.

I love diffraction glasses and have many of them. I prefer the "nerd style" flip up ones like this one because you can flip them up to see normal and down for diffraction effect.

Pros
-Low cost
-Much preferred over paper ones
-Fit comfortably
-Won't dissolve in the rain

Cons
-For some reason both the normal lense and the flip up lense are both diffraction - unlike my other pairs where the normal lense is just clear plastic and the flip up lense is diffraction. This may sound cool because you get double the diffraction!... but in reality one diffraction lense makes it hard enough to actually see things around you - two makes it practically impossible. Looking through both makes it so really all you can see is light pigments, without being able to make out your hand infront of your face. That being said I found it was preferred to just have one diffraction lense, not two. To solve this, I popped the lense out of the fixed part of the glasses so when flipped up you can see normal and when flipped down you get the diffraction effect. I ended up using the extra lense that I popped out over my cell phone camera for cool video effects. It would be cool to incorporate this into a cell phone case.

Overall it worked as I wanted it to. I would love to see a product like this that allows me to rotate the lense while I wear it so that the diffracted image can move without me having to tilt my head. Just a thought!
summary: Works, but fixed lense should not diffract. Only flip down lense should diffract in my opinion.

reviewText: The "normal" (non-flip up) lens on these glasses are also diffraction lenses, so you're always looking through some kind of diffraction. Flipping down the 2nd lens set merely doubles up on the diffraction and causes a very blurry, fuzzy image.
summary: The "normal" (non-flip up) lens on these glasses are also ...

What I loved about this top: the color (salmon) is beautiful; it is loose-fitting so will be cool in hot weather, but it still has shape, isn't just a big baggy top.
The negatives: the fabric is very loosely woven, which in itself could be good in hot weather. However, the piece arrived with 3 obvious snags which means there will be more - the kind that occur when the fabric catches on even the tiniest thing, leaving a small hole and a little piece of thread that I have learned NOT to cut or pull, creating the start of major unravelling.
I will not pay return postage on a defective item, so I will not purchase from this seller again.
summary: Paying return postage on defective item- not.

I don't write reviews, but in this case, I must.  I am a big dude and need extra long ties. I found that the "brick and mortar" store's "big and tall" ties are for the most part, poor quality and not stylish at all. My wife found the Long Tie Store (LTS) online and I'm so glad that she did. I have ordered approximately 10 - 12 ties from them over the course of a couple years now.  The silk, build quality, colors and durability are second to none. All of the ties that I have bought are very sharp and I get alot of comments at work. Also, I have never experienced the high level of customer service that I get from these folks. The ONE time that I had a problem with a tie, they shipped me a replacement immediately and I had it before my next meeting !!!  LTS is the only place that I buy ties from anymore.  Thanks,
Love ties from the long tie store!  Where were you when I was wearing a tie every day!?

At $79, I wasn't expecting heavyweight organza and taffeta, but it is modest satin and chiffon. The dress I received is not see through and the zipper works fine, although I did have to trim a few threads first. Again, for the price point, I knew I'd have to do some quality control myself. I did have to hand stitch in the straps and tighten a few stones, but very minor overall. It came with extra hook-on straps and a sash for the waist, as well as a few sequins for repair, but no extra stones. It was also extra long, and I trimmed off about 7" for my 5'2" daughter. It just skims her toes in 3" heels. I added a rolled (handkerchief) hem and it has a nice, floaty effect. For reference, the skirt seams are 3/8" two-thread overlock, and the hem is straight stitched, but too narrow to be let down further. We're very pleased with the dress, and it exceeded our expectations, especially for the price point.
summary: Very nice dress with unexpected details

After trying on 4 different kinds of maternity leggings (Old navy - too thin, Target, Blanqi - had a hole when they arrived and Storq - a bit expensive for what they were) these are my favorite.  I was looking for something that wasn't too thick since I'm pregnant during the summer but had high quality fabric and wasn't see through.  There leggings are made out of a nice fabric that doesn't seem like it will snag and they don't appear to be see through in any way.  The panel does seem just a tiny bit big but I'm sure it will fit in a few weeks (I'm currently 6.5 months pregnant.) I  was hesitant to buy these since they were pretty expensive but they are a great quality and even though they are marketed as active pant, I feel confident in pairing these with long tank or tunic and wearing it out, not just when I am being active.  I don't know how these will do postpartum as when I tried to roll the panel down, they got a bit weird in the back because of the design but I'll probably wear them anyways, at least while I am at home and on maternity leave.
summary: Finally, a quality and well fitting pair of maternity leggings!

reviewText: Really comfortable pants.  They fit perfectly.

Omg just buy the leggings! I put off buying maternity clothes for months and months and Im kicking myself. I ordered a medium (pre pregnancy size) at 7 months pregnant and they fit like a glove. Im 53 and they hit about three inches above my ankle. The leggings are very thick and stretchy. The belly band is comfortable and ill have room to grow. Im going to order a second pair for sure. Def worth the price and peace of mind that something actually fits and is flattering. I don't want to take them off.

I tried on a TON of maternity leggings before I decided to take a change and order these online. These are made of soft, strong material that has held up for many washes. They haven't started pilling or lightening. They are thick enough to cover cellulite (I got a lot of that as soon as I got pregnant) but not hot. I have LOVED these! I am 5' 9'" and these go to a little bit higher on the leg than what it shows on the model in the product picture. They have fit me from 15 weeks till now at 35 weeks! I'm sure they will fit me until the end of my pregnancy. I bought a large and before pregnancy I was about 165 lbs... perfect fit! Do yourself a favor and get these leggings! You will not regret it!
Great fit for workout/active wear. Material is thick & belly band very supportive. Best maternity activewear bottoms I have found.
Absolutely love these! The fabric is nice and thick but still has the perfect stretch. I was skeptical about the crossover back but it is actually very comfortable. Must buy for a growing belly!

Material quality is great. I'm 5'4" and 118 lb pre-maternity, now at 24 weeks at 138 lb, bought a Small based on the Ingrid & Isabel website info. I have  athletic legs and thought the fit was a bit snug- probably would have exchanged for a size M had the price not increased from $29.99 to $88.
summary: Size up if you have muscular legs or just want a slightly more relaxed fit
